c 11 -lrb- 44 -rrb- newfoundland -lrb- 45 -rrb- jidda -lrb- 46 -rrb- leo afric ramus v 1 f 373 section ii _ summary of portuguese discovery from the commencement of the fifteenth century to the discovery of america by columbus _ -lrb- 1 -rrb- accord to the chronicle of portugal john i go from lisbon in 1415 attend by he son don duarte or edward don peter and don henry and other lord and noble of he realm into africa where he take the great city of ceuta which be one of the principal cause of extend the dominion of portugal after they return don henry the king 's _ third _ -lrb- 2 -rrb- son be then in algarve and desirous to enlarge the kingdom by the discovery of unknown region give direction for discover the coast of mauritanium for in those day none of the portuguese have ever go beyond cape non in lat 29  n -lrb- 3 -rrb- for the better accomplishment of this purpose don henry prepare a fleet and command the officer whom he employ to proceed in make discovery to the south of that cape which they do but when they come to another cape name bajador none of they dare for a long time to go beyond it at which cowardice the prince be much displeased in 1417 in the reign of john ii of castile and while he mother the lady catharine be regent of the kingdom ruben de bracamonte the admiral of france crave a grant of the canary island and the title of king for he kinsman john de betancourt which be concede he depart from seville with a armament to attempt the conquest the principal motive of this enterprize be to make a perfect discovery of madeira of which macham have before give so much information yet he go to the canary where he carry a friar name mendo as bishop who have receive that dignity from pope martin v he reduce lanerota fuerteventura gomera and ferro whence he send into spain many slave and considerable quantity of honey wax camphire hide orchill fig dragons-blood and other merchandize of which he make good profit this armament be say to have likewise discover porto santo the island first occupy by betancourt be lanerota where he build a castle of stone for the better defense of the new settler in the year 1418 john gonzale zarco and tristram vaz teixera gentleman of the household to don henry perceive the great desire of they master to discover new country request and obtain a bark to proceed to the coast of africa where they be overtake by a violent tempest and drive into a haven of the island now call porto santo where they remain two year in 1420 they discover the island of madeira where they find the chapel tomb and stone on which macham have engrave he name other write that a castilian have inform don henry of have make the discovery of porto santo and that he send bartholomew perestrello john gonzale zarco and tristram vaz teixera purposely in search of that island accord to the sign and direction indicate by the castilian and that these person afterwards discover madeira in 1420 where they find the memorial and monument leave by macham the englishman betancourt who begin the conquest of the canary be slay in a war with the native leave one menante he heir who afterwards sell the island to one peter barba of seville but other say that john de betancourt go to france to procure reinforcement to enable he to complete he conquest and leave the command of lanerota with he nephew who hear nothing of he uncle and be unable to continue the contest with the native sell the canary to don henry for a estate in the island of madeira it be related that in 1424 don henry send a squadron with some land force under don ferdinando de castro on purpose to make a conquest of these island but be repulse by the bravery of the native de castro prudently desist from the enterprize and return home and that don henry afterwards resign he claim to these island in favor of the crown of castile the castilian writer however assert that both don henry and the king of portugal refuse to give up these island until the dispute be end by the judgment of pope eugenius iv who award they to the king of castile these island anciently call the insulae fortunata or fortunate island be seven in number in lat 28  n where the longest day be thirteen hour and the longest night the same they be 200 league distant from the coast of spain and 18 league from the coast of africa the people be idolater and eat raw flesh for want of fire they have no iron but raise or till the ground with the horn of ox and goat for want of better implement of husbandry every island speak a separate language and many pagan custom prevail among the native but now the christian religion be plant among they the commodity of these island be wheat barley sugar wine and canary-bird which be much esteem for the sweetness and variety of they song in the island of ferro they have no water but what proceeds in the night from a tree encompass by a cloud whence water issue and serve the whole inhabitant and cattle of the island -lrb- 4 -rrb- in the year 1428 don pedro the king 's _ eldest _ -lrb- 5 -rrb- son who be a great traveller go into england france and germany and thence into the holy land and other place and come home by italy through rome and venice he be say to have bring a map of the world home with he in which all part of the earth be describe by which the enterprize of don henry for discovery be much assist in this map the strait of magellan be call the _ dragons-tail _ and the cape of good hope the _ front of africa _ and so of the rest -lrb- 6 -rrb- i be inform by francis de sosa tavare that in the year 1528 don fernando the king 's eldest son shew he a map which have be make 120 year before and be find in the study of alcobaza which exhibit all the navigation of the east indy with the cape of bona sperana as in we latter map by which it appear that there be as much discover or more in ancient time as now -lrb- 7 -rrb- though attend with much trouble and expence don henry be unwearied in prosecute he plan of discovery at length giliane one of he servant pass cape bojador a place terrible to all former navigator and bring word that it be by no means so dangerous as have be represent he have land on its farther side where he set up a wooden cross in memorial of he discovery in the year 1433 die john king of portugal and be succeed by he eldest son duarte or edward in 1434 don henry send alphonso gonzale balduja and gilliane who penetrate from cape bajador to another cape where they find the country to be inhabit and go forward to another point of land whence they return to portugal in 1438 king duarte die and he son alphonso be young the kingdom be govern during he minority by he uncle don pedro in 1441 don henry send out two ship under tristan and antonio gonzale who take a prize on the coast and sail to cape blanco or the white cape in lat 20  n -lrb- 8 -rrb- from thence they bring home some moor from whom don henry learn the state of the country don henry send a account of these discovery to pope martin by one fernan lopez de savado and the pope grant indulgence and everlasting pardon of sin to all who should die in attempt the discovery of the land of the infidel in the year 1443 don henry command antonio gonzale to carry back the moor to they own country where they be ransom for black moor with curl hair or negro and some gold owe to which that place be now call rio de oro or the golden river that thereby the desire of discovery might be the more increase he send soon afterward one name nunnez tristan who discover the island of arguin who bring more slave from thence to portugal in 1444 one lancarote a groom of don henry chamber and three other armed certain ship with which they sail along the coast to the island of garze where they take 200 slave which be the first that be bring from thence to portugal in 1445 gonsalvo de syntra a esquire belong to don henry go captain of a bark into these part and landing on the coast be take by the native with six or seven of he people the place where he be cut off get the name of angra de gonsalvo de syntra from he and this be the first loss sustain by the portuguese in they discovery in 1446 three caravel be send out under antonio gonsale diego aloizio and gome perez who be order to refrain from go to rio de oro to carry themselves peaceably to the native to traffic with they peaceably and to endeavor to convert as many infidel as possible to christianity but in this they have no success in the same year denni fernande of lisbon a esquire to the king enter upon these discovery more to acquire fame than for profit in the course of he voyage he discover the river _ sanaga _ or senegal between 15 and 16 degree of latitude -lrb- 9 -rrb- and proceed onward discover cape verde in 14 degree -lrb- 10 -rrb- upon which he erect a wooden cross and then return much elate at the success of he voyage in 1447 nunnez tristan pass beyond cape verde to rio grande and go beyond that river to another in twelve degree -lrb- 11 -rrb- he be here take and slay with eighteen other portuguese and the ship be bring home in safety by four or five of the crew who escape the hand of the negro in this year 1447 a portuguese ship in come through the strait of gibraltar be force a great way to the westwards by a violent tempest and come to a island have seven city the inhabitant of which speak the portuguese language and they inquire of we mariner if the moor still infested spain whence they ancestor have flee to avoid the distress which occur subsequent to the death of don roderigo king of spain the boatswain of this ship bring home some of the sand from this island and sell it to a goldsmith in lisbon who procure from it a good quantity of gold don pedro who then govern the realm be make acquaint with this circumstance cause the whole to be record in the house of justice -lrb- 12 -rrb- some think that this island belong to what be now call the antille or new spain but though they reason for this opinion be good i omit they here as not connect with my present purpose in the year 1449 king alphonso grant license to he uncle don henry to colonize the aores which have be formerly discover in the year 1458 this king go into africa where he take the town of alcaer and in the year 1461 he command signior mendez to build the castle of arguin in the island of that name on the coast of africa in the year 1462 three genoese gentleman of whom antonio de noli be the chief the other be he brother and nephew get permission from don henry to take possession of the cape de verde island which some believe to be those call gorgade hesperide and dorcade by the ancient but they name they mayo saint jago and saint philip because discover on the day of those saint some call they the island of antonio in the year follow 1463 that excellent prince don henry die have discover by he exertion the whole coast of africa from cape non to the mountain of sierra liona which be on this side of the line in lat 8  30 ' n where no man have be before in 1469 the king of portugal let out the trade of guinea afterwards call the mina to fernan gomez for five year at the yearly rent of 200000 ree -lrb- 13 -rrb- and under the express condition that he be every year to discover 100 league farther along the coast of africa to the south in 1470 this king go into africa accompany by he son prince john where he take the town of arzilum and the inhabitant of tangier have flee from fear he take possession of it also in the year 1471 john de st aren and john de scovar under the order of fernan gomez continue the discovery of the coast of guinea as far as st george del mina in lat 5  n and 2  w long the coast from cape verde to cape palma trend se after which it go to the east with year 1492 when don ferdinand king of castile -lrb- 1 -rrb- be engage in the siege of granada he send _ one _ christopher columbus a genoese with three ship for the discovery of nova spagna this columbus have first offer he service lot a western discovery to john king of portugal who refuse to employ he be sufficiently furnished for he enterprize columbus set out from the town of palo on the third of August 1492 have with he as captain and pilot martin alionzo pinzon franci martinez pinzorus vincent yanne pinzon and bartholomew columbus he brother -lrb- 2 -rrb- with a hundred and twenty other person in the three ship some person affirm that this be the first voyage which be ever conduct by the observation of latitudes -lrb- 3 -rrb- they take the canary in they way whence shape they course for cipango or towards japan they be much amaze to find the sea all full of weed and with great fear arrive at the antille on the tenth day of October the first island they descry call guanahany by the native they name san salvador this island be in 25  n latitude after that they find many island which they call the prince the savage of those part call these island by the name of lucaio have indeed several name for they and they stand on the north side of the line almost under the tropic of cancer the island of st jame or jamaica lie between the 16th and 17th degree of northern latitude -lrb- 4 -rrb- thence they go to the island which the native call cuba name ferdinando by the spaniard after the king which be in 22 degree from whence they be conduct by the indian to another island call haytus name isabellum by the spaniard in honor of the queen of castile and afterwards hispaniolum or little spain in that island the admiral ship be wreck and columbus cause a fort to be construct of she timber and plank in which he leave roderigo de arana with a garrison of thirty-eight man to learn the language and custom of the country columbus then return to spain carry with he sample of gold and pearl and other production of the country with ten indian six of whom die on the voyage the rest be bring to spain and baptize on they way home columbus touch at the aores and on the fourth of march 1493 enter the port of lisbon this discovery give much discontent to the king of portugal immediately on he arrival columbus go into castile where he inform the king of he discovery and of the dissatisfaction of the king of portugal on this he and he queen isabellum send word of the recent discovery to pope alexander vi at which information he and all the italian be much astonished as they marvel that there should be any land besides what have be know to the roman alexander make a grant of all these country to the crown of castile and leon under condition that they should labor to extirpate idolatry and establish the holy faith of christ among the native on the report of this discovery so universal a desire of travel arise among the spaniard that they be ready as it be to leap into the sea that they might swim if possible to the newly discover island after receive the authority of the pope king ferdinando send columbus a second time to the newly-discovered country of which he make he admiral give he many other honor and a particular coat of arm have this motto for castile and for leon a new world discover colon -lrb- a -rrb- -lrb- a -rrb- gomara i 1 c 15 columbus set out on he second voyage to the antille on the 25th October 1493 take he course from cadiz with seventeen ship and fifteen hundred man accompany by he brother bartholomew and diego columbus with many other knight gentleman of the law and priest have chalice cross and other rich religious ornament and with great power and dignity from the pope the tenth day after commence they voyage they reach the canary and from thence in twenty-five or thirty day they sail to the antille the first island they see be in 14  n due west from cape de verd in africa they call this island deseada -lrb- 5 -rrb- or the _ desire island _ which be say to be 800 league from the canary they afterwards discover many more island which they call the virgin but which be name the caribbee island by the native from a nation of that name who be bold warrior and excellent marksman with bow and arrow they poison they arrow with the juice of a certain herb and whoever be wound with these be sure to die bite himself like a mad dog from thence they go to the principal island in these part name boriquen by the native and st john by the spaniard and thence to hispaniolum or isabellum where they find all the man dead whom they have leave on return from the former voyage columbus leave most of he people here to establish a colony under the command of he brother and go with two ship to continue he discovery of cuba and jamaica all these island be between 16 and 20 degree of northern latitude -lrb- 6 -rrb- while the admiral be sail in quest of discovery he brethren and those who be leave in hispaniolum be much incommode by a insurrection among the savage and columbus go back to spain to give a account of he proceedings to the king and queen in January 1494 a congress of ambassador from spain and portugal be hold at tordesilla for the settlement of all dispute between the two country respect the new discovery the plenipotentiary from spain be don henry henrique don john de cardenas and the doctor maldonado those from portugal ruy de sosa he son don john and the doctor ayre de almada after some conference these plenipotentiary divide the world between the two crown by a meridian line draw from north to south 300 league to the west of the island of cape verd all to the east of this line be appropriate to portugal and all to the west to spain leave however the liberty of navigation equally to both -lrb- 7 -rrb- in 1495 john ii king of portugal die and be succeed by he cousin emanuel in the year 1496 a venetian name john cabota or gabota go to england and have acquire a knowledge of the new discovery and perceive by the globe that the island of the antille be almost in the same latitude with he own country and lay much nearer to england than spain and portugal he acquaint henry vii with this circumstance and offer he service to make discovery for the crown of england henry be much pleased with the proposal and furnish he with two ship and three hundred man with which he set sail in the spring of that year and sail west till he come in sight of land in lat 45  n whence he sail northwards till he come into the latitude of 60 degree where the day be 18 hour long and the night be very clear and bright he there find the air very cold with great island of ice and find no bottom with a line of 100 fathom from thence find the land turn eastward he coast along it discover all the bay and river name deseado -lrb- 8 -rrb- to see if it pass on to the other side of the land cabot afterwards sail down the coast to the lat of 38  n though some people allege that he reach cape florida in 25  n in the year 1497 columbus be again send out on discovery with six ship furnish by the crown of spain and two other fit out at he own expence send he brother before he sail from cadiz take he son don diego along with he it be then report that he mean to take the island of madeira because he distrust the frenchman and therefore send three ship thither other say that he object be for the canary however this may be he go with four ship to the cape de verd island whence he run along a parallel finding great rain and calm and the first land he come to in the antille be a island in nine degree of north latitude call trinidada -lrb- 9 -rrb- which lie close to the main land here he enter the gulf of parium and come out by the bocca de dragone or dragons-mouth hold he course westwards along the coast of parium he come to the island call lo testigo or the witness beyond which be the island of cubagua where there be a great fishing for pearl-muscle and where also there be a well of rock oil beyond that he come to the fraile island name roque aruba and curaoa and other small island along the coast of the main land and to on they return sancho de thovar discover the city of sofalum on the eastern coast of africa it be report that in the year 1500 one gaspar cortereal get a general license from king emanuel to make discovery in the new world he fit out two stout ship at he own cost from the island of tercera and sail to that part of the new world which be in 50  n which have be since know by he name and come home in safety to lisbon in a second voyage he own immediate vessel be lose and the other come home upon this he brother michael cortereal go to seek he with three ship fit out at he own charge and find many creek and river on the coast the ship divide for the more effectual search agree that they should all meet again at a appoint time and place the other two ship do so but after wait a reasonable rime for michael cortereal it be conclude that he be also lose on which the other two ship return to lisbon and no news be ever afterwards hear of the two brother but the country where they be lose be still call the land of cortereal -lrb- 15 -rrb- in march 1501 john de nova sail from lisbon with four ship for indium in he outward-bound voyage he discover a island in the atlantic in lat 8  s to which he give the name of ascension -lrb- 16 -rrb- on he return from indium he fall in with another island in the atlantic in 17  s call st helena which though very small be yet of great fish the sea on that coast be so abundant in fish that the cat be in use to take they one antonio de saldanium be report to have discover socotora formerly name coradi and the cape of guardafu in 1503 in 1504 roderigo de bastidas formerly mention with the aid of john de ledesma and other of seville fit out two ship and take john de cosa as he pilot go on discovery to the terra firma of america coast they enter the gulf of uraba where they find sand mingled with gold be the first of that kind which be bring to spain from thence they sail for st domingo load with slave but almost famish for want of victuals as the native refuse to traffic with they for any in the end of this year isabellum queen of castile die while she live no subject of arragon catalonium valencium or any other of the province depend on she husband king ferdinand be allow to sail to any of the newly-discovered country but only she own subject of castile and biscay by whom all these land be discover except only such of she husband subject as might be in a servile capacity to she own or a few that could procure special licens in 1505 on the twenty-fifth of march francisco de almeida the viceroy of indium sail from return to cochin in the middle of this island there be a high rock have the print of a mans foot say to have be that of adam when he ascend to heaven which the indian hold in great reverence in 1506 after the death of isabellum king philip and queen joan come to take possession of the crown of castile and king ferdinand retire into he own dominion of arragon in that same year philip die and voyage arrive at cochin in the month of may the viceroy give he another ship in which he go to malacca in September pass between the island of nicubar and many other he go also to sumatra to the city of pedir and pacem and all along that coast to the island of puloreira and the fiat of capacium thence he stand over to the city of malacca in lat 2  n where the people take and slew some of he man after this he return to cochin have discover five hundred league in this voyage the island of sumatra be the first land in which we know of men flesh be eat by certain people in the mountain call baca who gild they tooth in they opinion the flesh of the black be sweeter than that of the whites the flesh of the oxen kine and hen in that country be as black as ink a people be say to dwell in that country call _ daraqui-dara _ have tail like sheep -lrb- 20 -rrb- there be likewise spring of rock oil or bitumen in the kingdom of pedir likewise there be say to be a river of oil which be not to be wonder at as we be assure there be also a well of oil in bactrium it be further say that there be a tree in that country the juice of which be a strong poison if it touch a mans blood but if drink it be a sovereign antidote against poison they have here also certain gold coin call drachm bring as they say into they country by the roman -lrb- 21 -rrb- which seem to have some resemblance to truth because beyond that country there be no gold coin in 1508 alphonso de hojeda go with the license of king ferdinand but at he own charge to conquer the province of darien in the terra firma of the new world landing in the country of uraba he call it castilia del oro or golden castile because of the gold find in the sand along its coast he go first from the city of san domingo in hispaniolum with four ship and three hundred soldier leave behind he the bachelor anciso who afterwards compile a book of these discovery he be follow by a fourth ship with provision and ammunition and a reinforcement of 150 spaniard hojeda land at carthagena where the native take slew and devour seventy of he man by which he force be much weaken some time after but in the same year diego de niquesa fit out seven ship in the port of bea intend to go to veragua with 800 man but come to carthegana where he find hojeda much weaken by he loss they join they force and avenge themselves of the native in this voyage niquesa discover the coast call nombre de dios and go into the sound of darien on the river pito which he name puerto de misas come to veragua hojeda go on shore with he soldier and build there the town of caribana as a defense against the caribbee be the first town build by the spaniard on the continent of the new world he also build another at nombre de dios and call it nuestra seniora de la antigua a town be build at uraba in which franci pisarro be leave with the command who be there much annoy by the native they likewise build other town the name of which i omit in this enterprize the spaniard do not meet with the success they expect in 1509 don diego columbus the second admiral of new spain go to the island of hispaniolum with he wife and household and she be a noble woman carry with she many lady of good family who be there marry by which mean the spaniard begin to multiply in they new colony and hispaniolum become famous and much frequented columbus likewise reduce cuba into order and take measure for its colonization where he place one diego velasque as he lieutenant who have accompany he father in he second voyage of discovery in April 1511 alphonso de albuquerque go to malacca from cochin and find certain chinese about to return from malacca into they own country he send a portuguese along with they name duarte fernande with letter for the king of the mantia now call siam they pass through the strait of cincapura and sail northwards along the coast of patane to the city of cuy and thence to odia the chief city of the kingdom in 14  n -lrb- 22 -rrb- the king of this country receive duarte with great honor as he be the first portuguese who have be in these part and send back ambassador along with he to albuquerque they travel overland to the westwards till they come to tanacerim on the bay of bengal in 12  n where they embark in two ship and sail to malacca the inhabitant of siam through which they travel eat of all kind of beast and even of what we repute to be vermin the people of this country be repute the most virtuous and honest of any in those part of the world and pride themselves much on they poverty and chastity yet have a strange practice of carry round bell within they foreskin which be not permit to the king and priest they do not rear any poultry or pigeon about they house the kingdom be 250 league in length and 80 in breadth -lrb- 23 -rrb- elephant be so numerous in this country that on go to war the king be say to carry 30000 into the field besides other which be leave in the several garrison this king have great pride in the possession of a white elephant have red eye which glare like a flame of fire in this country there be a certain species of small vermin which attach itself to the trunk of the elephant to suck they blood by which many elephant die the skull of this insect -lrb- 24 -rrb- be so hard as to be impenetrable to a musket shot they have on they liver the figure of man and woman which the native call toketa resemble a mandrake and it be affirm that whoever have one of these about he can not be kill by a iron weapon they have also wild kine in this country in the head of which certain stone be find which have the virtue to bring good fortune to merchant after the return of duarte fernande from siam albuquerque send a knight name ruy nunnez de acunha as ambassador to the king of the sequie the country we now call pegu he go in a junk of the country pass cape rachado and thence to the city of pera on the river salano on which river be many other village where duarte have be before and he afterwards go by tanaerim to the city of martavan in 15  n and the city of pegu in 17  n this be the first portuguese who travel in that kingdom and who bring back a good account of the country and people in the end of 1511 albuquerque send three ship to the island of banda and molucca under command of antonio de breu and francis serrano with a hundred and twenty man pass through the strait of saban and along the island of sumatra and other island on they leave name the salite they come to the island of palimbang and lu-suparam whence they sail by the noble island of java and eastward between it and the island of madura in this last island the man be strong and warlike and care little for they life even they woman go out to war these people be almost continually engage in war and mutual slaughter like the moco and seem to place they only delight in bloodshed beyond java they come to another island call balus and afterwards to avajave sambaba solor galao malva vitara rosalanguin and arus whence be bring beautiful bird in much estimation on account of they feather -lrb- 25 -rrb- beyond these island they come to number of other lie in 7 or 8 degree of south latitude all so close together as to appear like one entire mainland and stretch near 500 league in length the ancient cosmographer describe all these island by one general name the _ javo _ but more recent knowledge have find that they have all separate name beyond these and more to the north there be other island which be inhabit by a whiter people clothe in shirt doublet and trowser something like the portuguese dress and who also have silver money they magistrate carry red stave in they hand as badge of command and seem to have some affinity in this respect with the people of china there be other island in these part or which the inhabitant be red and it be report they be the same people with the chinese de breu go northwards to the small island of gumnape or ternate from the highest part of which flake or stream like fire fall continually into the sea he go thence to the island of burro and amboyna and come to anchor in the haven of guligulus where in a village near a river they find dead man hang up in the house as the people be cannibal here they burn the ship of serrano as she be old and rotten and go to a place on the other side of the island in 8  s they load clove nutmeg and mace in a junk or barque which serrano buy it be say that in a island not far from banda there be immense quantity of snake especially in a cave in the center of the island the same be say of formentera in the mediterranean anciently ophiusa between majorca and minorca on they return from banda towards malacca in 1512 franci serrano perish with he junk on the flat call baxos de luapinho nine or ten of the portuguese crew escape to the island of mindanao who be send for by the king of the molucca these be the first of the portuguese who come to the island of clove which be in lat 1  n and they remain there seven or eight year some portuguese and prince of the moor once endeavor to go near that part of the isle of ternate which throw out fire but could not accomplish it but antonio galvano accomplish this enterprise and find a spring so cold that he could not bear he hand in the water nor suffer any of it in he mouth though almost directly under the line in these molucca island there be certain man who have spur on they ancle like cock and i be tell by the king of tidore that in the island of batochina there be people with tail who have a lactiferous nipple on the scrotum there be small hen also in these part many of which be black in the flesh and lay they egg larger than those of duck in hole above nine foot under ground they have likewise hog with horn and excellent talk parrot which they call _ noris _ there be also a river so very hot that it take off the skin of any living creature that bathe in its water and yet contain live fish they crab be very sweet to eat yet they claw be so strong that they will break the iron of a pickax and there be small hairy crab in the sea which be rank poison as whoever eat of they immediately die in these sea be certain oyster call _ bras _ have shell of so great size that they might serve as font for baptize child in these sea there be certain live stone which grow and increase like plant of which excellent lime may be make by burn in the usual manner when take fresh from the sea but if allow to remain long in the air it lose all its strength and will not afterwards burn into line there be a tree which bear flower only at sunset which fall off immediately when blow there be likewise a certain fruit whereof if a woman who have conceive shall eat the child by and by move there be farther a certain herb which followeth the sun and remove after it which be a strange and marvellous thing in 1512 while on the voyage from malacca to goa the ship in which albuquerque embark be lose simon de andrada and a few portuguese be drive among the maldivium island where they remain till they learn the fate of the viceroy these island be low small and very numerous and be full of palm tree or _ cocoa _ which be good against all kind of poison in this year 1512 john de solis a native of lisbon and chief pilot to king ferdinand go from spain by license to discover the coast of brazil follow the course of the pinson he go to cape st augustine and thence sail along the whole coast to the harbor of de lagoa and in lat 35  s he discover a river call parana-guau or the great river and from sign of silver he give it the name of rio de la plata or the river of silver it be even say that he go farther at this time and return into spain give a account of he discovery to king ferdinand from whom he demand and obtain leave to colonize the country and receive the appointment of governor on this he provide three ship and return to that country in 1515 but be slay by the native the family of de solis produce several great discovery in these part -lrb- 26 -rrb- in the same year 1512 john ponce de leon who have be governor of the island of st john in the antille arm two ship with which he go in search of the island of boyuca where it be report there be a spring which make old man young again but after search for six month he could not find it in 25  n he discover a point of the continent upon easter-day which he call the country of florida and because he expect the land would yield gold and silver he beg it from king ferdinand but die in the discovery of the country as many have do before in the year 1513 vasco nunne de valboa or balboa hearing of the _ south sea _ determine to go thither and be a man of courage though strongly dissuade by several of he company he march on the enterprize with 290 man leave darien on the first of September and take some indian along with he as guide he march directly across the isthmus sometimes without opposition and have at other time to fight he way in a certain place call careca he find some negro with curl hair who be captive among the indian at length on the 25th of the same month of September be the festival of st michael he come in sight of the south sea : he there embark in a canoe much against the will of _ chiape _ the cacique of that part of the coast who endeavor to persuade he that the navigation be very dangerous but he persist in he design that he might be the first who have navigate this new discover sea and come back in safety he return thence to darien bring with he a good store of gold silver and pearl which he have take during the march and for this good service he be much honor and favor by king ferdinand in February 1513 alphonsus de albuquerque go from goa towards the strait of mecca with twenty ship and arrive at the city of aden batter it with he cannon and pass the strait enter the red sea and winter at the island of camaran this be the _ first _ portuguese captain who give a account of the red sea and the persian gulf which be of great importance in regard to trade in may 1514 pedro arias de avila be send out from st lucar as governor of castilia del oro or the golden castile for so the spaniard name the country of darien carthagena and uraba he carry with he fifteen hundred man and seven ship and vasco nunne de balboa who discover the south sea be send out at the same time as admiral of the coast of that newly discover sea in the beginning of the year 1515 de avila send gaspar morale with 150 man to the gulf of st michael to discover the island of tararequus -lrb- 27 -rrb- chiape and tumaccus a cacique the friend of balboa give he many canoe or boat make of one tree with which they pass to the isle of pearl where they be at first resist but chiape and tumaccus pacify the cacique of that island who submit himself and receive baptism take the name of the governor pedro aria and present morale with a basket of pearl weigh 110 pound some of which be as large as hazel nut weigh 20 25 26 and even 31 carat each of four grain and one of these pearl be sell for 1200 ducat in march 1515 de avila send gonsalva de badajos with 80 soldier to discover new land who go to nombre de dios where he be join by lewis de mercado with a reinforcement of 50 man they resolve to proceed to the south as the richest country and take some indian as guide they find some slave along the coast mark with the iron use by the portuguese they march a considerable way through the country with much difficulty but make a considerable booty in gold and take forty serviceable slave but a caique name pariza attack they and slew or take most of the party after this the governor send out he son john arias de avila to be revenge and to explore the country this party go westwards to cape de guerra in little more than 6  n and thence to punta de borica and to cape blanco in 8  30 ' n have as they affirm discover 250 league and besides this they found the city of panama in the month of may 1515 alphonsus de albuquerque the portuguese viceroy of indium send fernando gome de limo from ormus as ambassador to the xec or shah ismael king of persium and it be say they travel 300 league through a country as pleasant as france this xec or shah ismael go much a-hunting and be fond of trout fishing which be abundant in the river of he kingdom the woman of persium be the most beautiful in the world insomuch that alexander the great use to call they the _ golden-eyed woman _ in this year die the viceroy alphonsus de albuquerque who be succeed by lopez suare in 1516 fernando perez de andrada be command by the king of portugal to pass to the great kingdom of china and likewise to bengalum with a dispatch to john coelo who be the first portuguese who drink of the water of the gange in April 1517 andrada take in a loading of pepper at cochin as the principal merchandize for sale in china for which country he sail with eight ship four portuguese and four malayan on he arrival in china finding he could not be allow to land without a embassy he dispatch thoma perez with instruction for that purpose from the city of canton where they come to anchor the embassy travel 400 league by land to the city of pekin where the king reside for china be the largest kingdom in the world from sailana in the south which be in 20  n it reach to the latitude almost of 50  n which must be 500 league in length and it be say to be 300 league in breadth -lrb- 28 -rrb- fernando perez be fourteen month in the isle of veniaga endeavor to acquire as much knowledge as he could of the country and although one raphael perestrello have formerly be there in a junk belong to some merchant of malacca yet perez certainly deserve the merit of this discovery as well because he act by the command of the king he master as in discover so much by land by means of thoma perez and by sea through george mascarenha who sail to the city of foquiam in 24  n in the year 1517 in which charle afterwards emperor come into spain franci fernande de cordova christopher morante and lopez ochoa armed three ship from cuba at they own expence have also with they a barque belong to the governor diego velasque with which they come to land in jucutan in 20  n at a place which they call punta de las duennas which be the first place in which temple and house of stone and lime have be see in the new world the people here who be better clothe than in any other place have cross which they worship and set upon the tomb of they dead whence it appear as if they have formerly be in the faith of christ and some suppose that this have be the situation of the _ seven city _ in this expedition they be upon the north coast of jucutan be the first discovery of new spain or mexico and they return thence to cuba with some sample of gold and some prisoner in the year 1518 -lrb- 29 -rrb- lopez suare command don john de silveira to go and make peace with the maldive island which he do accordingly from thence silveira go to the city of chatigam or chittigong on one of the mouth of the gange under the tropic of cancer for it be to be note that this river and the indus which lie 100 league beyond diu and the river of canton in china all fall into the sea under one parallel of latitude although before this period fernando perez have be command to sail to bengal yet silveira must be look upon as the actual discoverer of that country for he go as captain-general and remain there long make himself acquaint with the manners of the people and the commodity of the country in the same year 1518 -lrb- 30 -rrb- diego velasquez governor of the island of cuba dispatch he nephew john de grisalva on the first of may with four ship and two hundred soldier to discover jucutan on the 3d of may he fall in with the island of cozumel in 19  north latitude which he name santa cruz because discover on the 3d of may be the anniversary of the holy cross grisalva coast along the land on the west side of the bay of hondura and come to a island which he name ascension because discover on ascension day they go unto the end of that island in 16  of latitude whence they come back find no passage -lrb- 31 -rrb- and proceed to a river in lat 17  n which they call the river of grisalva they be boldly oppose by the people on this coast yet they bring thence some gold silver and feather and return to cuba in the same year franci garay fit out three ship from jamaica at he own expence and go to cape florida in lat 25  n which seem a most pleasant island and think it better to people island than the firm land because more easily conquer and keep under subjection he go on land but the inhabitant of florida kill a great many of he people and he be force to re-embark and go away sail from thence he come to the river of panuco 500 league from cape florida sailing all the way along the coast and endeavor to land in various place but the native repulse he in every place many of he people be kill and eat by the savage in chilum the native hang up they skin in the temple of they god as a memorial of they own valor yet garay visit this place next year as he have see some indication of gold and silver and even apply to the emperor to be appoint governor of the coast he have discover in February 1519 -lrb- 32 -rrb- fernando cortez sail from cuba for the country now call new spain with eleven ship and 550 spaniard he land first in the island of cozumel where he immediately destroy all the idol and plant cross and image of the virgin on all the altar from thence he go to the cabo de las duennas on the peninsula of yucatan and thence to the river of tabasco where he attack a city call potoncion this place be surround with wood the house be build of stone and lime and roof with tile and the people resist the assailant manfully but st jame appear on horseback to the assistance of the spaniard and they take the place this as the first town subdue by they on the continent they name vittorium from thence they go to a place name st juan de vilhua say to be 60 or 70 league from mexico where one tendillus be governor for king muteuma though the spaniard and he could not understand each other yet tendilli give they good entertainment corte have twenty woman along with he expedition one of whom name marine be bear in the country of the indian and be the first native of new spain who receive baptism she and anguilar serve as interpreter between corte and the native tendillus send immediate intelligence to muteuma that there have arrive in he country a bearded people for so they call the castilian on the reception of this news muteuma be greatly trouble for he god or devil rather have reveal that a people of the description of these spaniard be to overthrow he law and dominion and to become lord of the country wherefore muteuma send gift to the value of twenty thousand ducat to corte but refuse any interview as the ship could not ride in safety at st juan de vilhua cortes send francis de montejo and the pilot antonio alamino in two brigantine to look out for a safe anchorage they go to panuco in lat 23  n whence they come back to culvacan as a safer harbor but corte go by land westwards to a city name zempoallan where he be well receive from thence he go to chiavitztlan with the lord of which town and of all the surrounding country he enter into a league against muteuma on the arrival of he ship at the appoint haven he go there and build a town which he name _ villa rica de la vera cruz _ from thence he send a vessel to spain with present and a letter to the emperor charle v give a account of he proceedings and of he determination to visit muteuma and solicit a commission as governor of the country -lrb- 33 -rrb- before proceed on he march to mexico corte destroy all he ship lest he man might mutiny as they seem disposed and leave 150 spaniard in vera cruz with as many indian to serve they he begin he march go first to zempoallan he learn that franci garay be on the coast with four ship and he contrived to inveigle nine of he man from whom he understand that garay who have be in florida be now at the river panuco where he have get some gold and mean to remain and build a town now call almerium corte destroy the idol of zempoallan and overthrow the tomb of they king whom the people worship as god and exhort they to worship the true god he set out from zempoallan for mexico on the 16th of August 1519 and after three day march come to the city of zalapan and thence to another name sicuchimatl at both of which place he be well receive and be offer to be conduct to mexico such be the order of muteuma go from thence he ascend a hill three league high on which vine be see grow and in another place he see above a thousand load of wood ready cut beyond this he pass a plain country which he name nombre de dios at the foot of this mountain he rest he troops at a place call teuhixuacan whence through a desert country he come to another mountain which be cover with snow and excessively cold and where the troops rest in a town name zacotlan march thus from town to town he arrive at a territory call tlaxcallan which be at war with muteuma and as the people be valiant they fight against corte but at length they agree and form a league with he against the mexican thus from country to country he come at length within sight of mexico and muteuma be afraid receive he kindly give he and all he people lodgings in the capital and all thing necessary after a time fear to be slay corte make muteuma prisoner and bring he to he own quarter keep he under a secure guard corte inquire at muteuma the extent of he dominion where the mine of gold and silver be and the number of king who dwell in the land and join eight intelligent spaniard with a equal number of indian he send they in four company to travel into four separate country zucollum malinaltepec tenich and tututepec the messenger to zucollum have 80 league to travel and those who go to malinaltepec 70 both of which province be under subjection to muteuma : they find both of these country fertile and well peopled and they bring back sample of gold which the native find in the river the country of tenich be at war with muteuma and would not admit the mexican into they country but they send ambassador to corte with present offer he they amity at which muteuma be much displeased those who go to tututepec near the south sea bring back sample of gold and praise the pleasantness of the country report that there be many good harbor on the coast and they present to corte a beautiful cloth of cotton on which the coast with all its harbor and creek be distinctly represent but at this time by the come of pamphilus de narvaez the whole kingdom of mexico be throw into confusion on the 10th August 1519 fernando de magellane go from seville with five ship on a voyage for the island of malacca -lrb- 34 -rrb- go along the coast of brazil he come to the rio plata which have be previously discover by the spaniard thence prosecute he voyage of discovery he come to port st julian in lat 49  s where he lose one of he ship with the remain four he come to the strait name after himself in 52  80 ' s and winter in that place where he and he people endure much distress from snow and ice and extreme cold they find the people of the country of extraordinary stature and great strength insomuch that they take man by the leg and rent they asunder as easily as one of we could tear a hen in two these people name _ patagane _ but call _ morca _ by the brazilian live on fruit and by the produce of the chase in the beginning of September of the following year 1520 the weather become somewhat temperate and leave port st julian magellane go to the strait which now bear he name whence one of the ship return to spain of which stephen de porto a portuguese be captain and pilot the other three pass through into a vast sea call the _ pacific _ where they find no inhabit land till they arrive in lat 13  n when they come to certain island name _ lo jardine _ they sail thence to the archipelago of st lazarus where in a island name _ matan _ magellane be slay and he ship burn the remain two ship go to borneo and thence to the molucca leave many other discover which i do not mention because i have not see any exact account of this voyage -lrb- 35 -rrb- about this time pope leo x send paulus centurio on a embassy to the great duke of muscovy require he to send a army along the coast of tartary into indium and the duke be almost persuade to have make the attempt if certain inconveniency have not hinder -lrb- 36 -rrb- in February 1520 diego lopez de sequeira governor of indium sail by the strait of mecca -lrb- 37 -rrb- carry with he the ambassador of prester john and roderigo de lima who be send ambassador to that prince they come to the island of maua or massoua on the african shore of the red sea in lat 17  n where the ambassador and they country call chicora and gualdape and to the river jordan and cape st helena in lat 32  n -lrb- 38 -rrb- the spaniard land here and be hospitably receive by the native who furnish they with every great difficulty and danger drive out of mexico and have only 504 footman and 40 horse remain corte retire with much difficulty to tlaxcallan where he be well receive he here muster a force of 900 spanish infantry and 80 cavalry and gather 200000 indian among the friend and ally whom he have secure enemy of the mexican and march back to mexico which he take in August 1521 -lrb- 39 -rrb- in obedience to retain this country under subjection he build a town call _ medelin _ 120 league from mexico and another name _ santo spirito _ on a river four league from the sea -lrb- 40 -rrb- in this year 1521 die emanuel king of portugal and be succeed by he son john iii in this same year one of magellan 's ship sail from malacca with a loading of clove they victual at the island of burro and go from thence to timor in lat 11  s -lrb- 41 -rrb- beyond this island about 100 league they come to other island all inhabit one of which be call _ eude _ pass on the outside of sumatra they find no carak have six mast with sail and shroud and have arm horseman on board -lrb- 45 -rrb- in may 1523 antonio de britto the portuguese governor of the molucca isle send simon de bru to discover the to take possession of he government some man join he from jamaica where he have furnish he squadron with warlike ammunition and sailing thence to the harbor of xagua in the island of cuba he there difficult march he arrive at panuco but find no provision the country have be exhaust in the war with corte and by be plunder by the soldier from this place he send gonalo de ocampo to st stephano or letters-patent to garay who think it better for he to yield himself to corte and go accordingly to mexico -lrb- 48 -rrb- in the same year 1523 gil gonales de avila discover and people a town call _ have spend above three year in the discovery with much labor and great danger -lrb- 58 -rrb- in the same year 1525 seven ship be fit out from spain under the command of garcia de loaisa for a voyage sebastian gabota chief pilot to the emperor a native of bristol in england whose father be a venetian sail from seville with four ship intend to have go to the molucca by a western course gabota come ship there and go with the boat of the squadron 120 league or 480 mile farther up the river parana which the inhabitant consider to be the principal river he here construct a fort and remain in that place above a year from thence he row still farther up the parana till he come to the mouth of another river call _ paragioa _ or paraguay and perceive that the country produce gold and silver he keep on he course send one of the boat in advance which be take by the native on this gabota think it more prudent to return to he fort after have penetrate 200 league or 800 mile up this river he take on board the people he have leave at the fort and return to the ship at the bar sail back to seville in 1530 he report that the rio plata be navigable for a great way and that it rise from a lake name _ bombo _ -lrb- 60 -rrb- in the kingdom of peru whence flow through the valley of xauxa it receive the river parso bulcasban cay parima hiacax and several other by which its water be greatly increase it be also say that the river of san francesco come from the same lake which likewise be very great because river that flow from lake be larger than those which proceed from spring in the year 1527 panfilo de narvaez sail from st lucar de barameda with five ship have 600 soldier 100 horse and great abundance of provision ammunition and all other necessaries to take possession of florida as far as the river palma of which he be appoint governor not be able to land at the place he wish he go on shore with 300 of he soldier some horse and a supply of provision nearer cape florida order the which the spaniard name _ malhada _ in this island they be attack by the native and many both of the spaniard and native be slay narvaez and he people see some gold among the indian of florida who say they have it from _ apalachen _ he therefore go to that town in search of gold where they find abundance of bay tree and other of many different kind and plenty of beast and bird but neither gold nor silver from apalachen he go to a town call aute and from : thence to xamo a poor and barren country in this place the native request the spaniard to cure they sick of whom they have great number and the spaniard be in extreme poverty and distress pray for the sick and use such endeavor as be in they power towards they relief : and it pleased god that many both of the sick and those who be ill from wound recover nay even one that be suppose to be dead be by they restore to life owing to this the spaniard be greatly esteem and even repute as god so that the people offer they no injury and even give they such thing as they have by these means they pass through many country and many strange nation differ from each other in language custom and dress and come at length among a people that live continually among they flock and herd like the arab many of the tribe through which they travel be so poor as to feed on snake lizard spider ant and all kind of vermin yet be well contented with they hard fore and be much give to singing and dancing this people be report to purchase all they wife from they enemy and to kill all they own daughter lest by marry into hostile tribe they enemy should increase in number in some place the woman continue to suckle they child till they be ten or twelve year old and there be certain man be hermaphrodite who marry each other in this manner the spaniard penetrate above 800 league or 3200 mile through the country till at length not above seven or eight of the whole armament reach the city of st michael of calvacan in lat 23  n or higher on he discover a island which he call _ de lo pintado _ or of the paint people as the inhabitant be of a white complexion but marked with a hot iron -lrb- 62 -rrb- and from various circumstance he conclude that they be originally from china a kind of boat put off from the shore contain a number of these islander make many threatening sign and gesture as if order the spaniard to go away from they land and even proceed to throw stone from sling at the ship but as the stone do no harm saavedra would not allow he people to fire upon they a little beyond this island in 10  or 12  of north latitude they discover a group consist of many small low island cover with grass and full of palm tree to which they give the name of _ lo jardine _ or the garden -lrb- 63 -rrb- saavedra come to anchor in the midst of these island where he remain several day and conclude that the people have come originally from china but have by long residence degenerate into lawless savage use no labor or industry they wear a species of white cloth make of grass and be quite ignorant of fire which put they in great terror instead of bread they eat cocoa which they pull unripe bury they for some day in the sand and then lay they in the sun which cause they to open they eat fish also which they catch from a kind of boat call _ parao _ or _ proa _ which they construct with tool make of shell from pine wood that be drift at certain time to they island from some unknown region the wind and weather become more favourable for he return to new spain saavedra resume he voyage thither intend to have go to panama to unload the clove and other merchandize he have bring from the molucca he purpose be to have carry this merchandize in cart from panama about four league or sixteen mile overland to the river chagre which be say to be navigable and which discharge itself into the north sea not far from nombre de dios where the goods could be reshipp for spain by which mean all kind of goods might be bring from indium in a shorter time and with less danger than by sail round the cape of good hope as the voyage from the molucca to panama be almost a perfectly straight course between the line and the tropics but in the present voyage they be never able to procure a favourable wind and be therefore force back to the molucca where they arrive in great affliction as saavedra die by the way -lrb- 64 : -- 1 from the gulph of st michael to uraba which be 25 league or 100 mile 2 from panama to nombre de dios which be 17 league or 68 mile much the greater part consist of the river chagre navigable be navigable by large boat and lighter 4 the other place be from tecoantepec through a river to verdadera cruz in the bay of hondura -lrb- 65 -rrb- in the year 1529 damiano de go a portuguese travel travels which occupy he during 22 year he see speak to and be conversant with all the king prince noble and chief city of all christendom for which reason i think the great extent of he travels be worthy of remembrance in 1529 or 1530 melchior de sosa tavarez go from ormus to bassora and the island of gissara with some ship of war and sail up to where the euphrate and tigri unite together be eldest brother guascar pizarro set these prisoner at liberty on promise of procure he a friendly reception in peru but they forget they engagement afterwards and excite the people to war against the he make search for a secure haven on the coast and find one every way to he wish at payta in the same year 1531 diego de ordas go with 600 soldier and 35 horse to settle the country on the maranon or mendoa sail from acapulco to the harbor of xalisco or xali on the river baranium in lat 22  n where he wish to take in wood and water but he be resist there by the order of nunnes de gusman and oblige where he take king atabalipa prisoner who engage to pay a vast sum in gold and silver for he ransom on purpose to procure this pedro de varco and ferdinando do sotto be send to the city of cusco in lat 17  s -lrb- 68 -rrb- a journey of 200 league all upon causeway of stone with bridge wherever necessary and have lodging-place at proper distance for the conveniency of the _ ynga _ by which name the king of peru be distinguish the army of the peruvian be very numerous as they often bring more than 100000 man into the field and they lodge on these causeway as already mention where they always have abundance of provision and other necessaries as be say to be the custom in china ferdinando pizarro go with some horseman to paciacama 100 league from caxamalca to discover the country and on he return he learn that guascar the brother of atabalipa have be put to death by he command and that ruminaguy the general of the army of atabalipa have rise in arm in the city of quito against the spaniard after the reception of this intelligence atabalipa be strangle by the order of pizarro -lrb- 69 -rrb- after the death of the two king of the peruvian pizarro continually extend he authority over the dominion of peru and build many city town and fort in convenient situation to hold the country under subjection he detach sebastian de benalcazar whom he have before make governor of st michael de tangarara with 200 infantry and 80 horse to quito against ruminaguy benalcazar proceed successfully in reduce the country to subjection from one city to another eastward for 120 league not far from the equinoctial line where peter alvarado find certain mountain so cold and load with such quantity of snow that 70 of he man be freeze to death have reduce the city of quito he establish himself and he people in that place call it the city of st franci and it seem very strange to the spaniard to find in that country abundance of cattle wheat barley and other plant similar to those of spain after send benalcazar to reduce the city of quito pizarro himself undertake to reduce the royal residence of cusco in about 13  20 ' s in which expedition he be oppose by quisquiz a peruvian general whom he easily defeat and he soon afterwards take possession of cusco the exceedingly rich and wealthy capital of the peruvian monarchy about this time mango a brother of atabalipa join pizarro who make he ynga or king of the country in name only while he assume the whole authority and revenue of the kingdom to himself -lrb- 70 -rrb- in the same year 1534 jaque cartier a native of be useful to man the principal tree be name _ metl _ which do not grow either very tall or very thick the native plant and dress this tree as we do we vine and they allege that it have forty different kind of leaf resemble weave cloth which serve for many useful purpose when tender these leaf be make into conserve from it they make a kind of paper and a substance like flax and it be also manufacture into mantle mat shoe girdle and cordage this tree produce such strong and sharp prickle that they be use instead of needle for sew the root be use as fuel and they ash make excellent ley for the manufacture of soap the native open up the earth from the root of this tree and by scrape or wound they they extract a juice which be a rich syrup by boil this juice it be convert into honey and when purify it become sugar and may likewise be make into wine and vinegar the fruit of this tree be call _ coco _ the rind roasted crushed and apply to sore or wound have a most healing quality the juice of the root and top mix with incense be a sovereign antidote against the bite of a viper and other poison from all these useful property this be the most profitable tree that be know in these part -lrb- 88 -rrb- there be certain bird in new spain call vicmalim have a long small bill which live on dew and the juice of rose and other flower they feather be very small and of beautiful color and be much esteem to work up into ornament with gold these bird die or sleep rather every year in the month of October sit on a small bough in some warm and close place and they revive again in country certain mountain call the ande extend from north to south which divide brazil on the east from peru or the empire of the inca on the west in the same manner the mountain of taurus and imaus divide asia into two part which mountain begin on the mediterranean in 36 or 37 degree of north latitude over against the island of rhode and cyprus and extend eastward to the sea of china thus range accompany with sudden and violent tempest of wind there be so great a scarcity of wood in these part that the inhabitant use turf or peat for fuel as be do in flander in these mountain and country the soil be in some place black in other white or red blue green yellow and violet and with some of these earth the native dye various color without use any other mixture from the bottom of these mountain but principally on the east side there flow many river both small and great among these be the river amazon st franci and la plata and many other which pervade the country of brasil -lrb- 91 -rrb- which be much larger than those of peru or of castilia del oro the country of peru between the ande and the western sea or pacific be from 15 to 20 league in breadth all of a hot sandy tender a texture that the leaf drop off on the slightest touch among these herb and fresh flower the native often dwell without bed or house even like cattle in the field and some of they have tail -lrb- 92 -rrb- these people be gross and wear long hair but have no beard and they speak diver language one of the plant of this region call _ aipo _ resemble rue and bear a yellow flower which cure all kind of rotten sore yet if apply to sound flesh will eat it to the bone they say that these mountain abound in tiger lion bear wolf wild - cat fox dantes ounce hog and deer and with many bird both report that from tumbez to chili there be no peacock hen cock nor any eagle hawk kite or other ravenous bird but there be many duck goose hern pigeon partridge quail and many other kind of bird there they on land it try to pick out they eye that they may not see they way back to the water and then kill they and the fight between the bittern and the seal be say to be a pleasant sight those who live on the top of the ande between the cold and the heat be mostly blind of one eye and some be totally blind so that hardly can two man be find but one of they at least be half blind notwithstanding the say satisfy both hunger and thirst it be affirm that from tumbez southward for the space of 500 league there be neither rain thunder nor lightning with only some light shower in peru there be certain long in the year 1540 the viceroy don antonio de mendoa send ferdinando alorchon with two ship to explore the bottom of the gulph of californium and diver other country in the same year gonsalvo pizarro go from quito to discover the _ cinnamon _ country of which there run a great fame in peru take with he a force of 200 spaniard partly horse and part foot with 300 indian to carry the baggage he march to _ guixo _ the most distant place or frontier of the empire of the inca in which place there happen a great earthquake accompany with much rain and dreadful lightning by which seventy house be swallow up from that place they pass over a chain of cold and snowy mountain where they find many indian freeze to death and they wonder much at find so much snow immediately under the equinoctial line from thence they proceed to a province call _ cumaco _ where they be detain two month on account of constant rain and beyond this they come to the cinnamon tree which be of great size with leaf resemble those of the bay tree the leaf branch root and every part of this tree taste like cinnamon but this taste and flavor be particularly strong in the root yet that be still stronger in certain knob like _ alcornoque _ or acorn which be good merchandize this appear to have be of the same nature with wild cinnamon of which there be great abundance in the east indy particularly in the island of _ jaoa _ or java from this cinnamon country they proceed onward to the province and city of coca where they halt for fifty day after which they travel for sixty league along a river without be able to find any bridge or ford at which they could pass over in one place they find this river to form a cataract of 200 fathom in perpendicular fall make such a noise as be almost sufficient to deafen any person who stand near not far beyond this fall the river be find to glide in a smooth channel wear out of the rock and at this place they construct a bridge by which they pass to the other side and enter into a country call guema which be so poor that they could only get fruit and herb to subsist upon travel onward from that place they come to a district where the people have some degree of civilization and wear cotton clothing of they own manufacture and use canoe they here build a brigantine in which and in some canoe procure or take from the native they embark they sick with they treasure provision and spare apparel under the charge of francis de orellana while gonsalvo pizarro march by land with the rest of the people along the river go every night into the boat in this manner they proceed for about 200 league when one night on come to the river side in hope of join the boat as usual pizarro could not see or hear of they he and he people be reduce by this unfortunate incident to a state of almost utter despair : in a strange poor and barren country without provision clothing or any other convenience and at a vast distance from they friend with a prodigious extent of difficult and dangerous road interpose between they and quito they be reduce to the necessity of eat they horse and even they dog yet hold a good heart they proceed onward in they journey for eighteen month penetrate as be say almost 500 league without ever see the sun or any thing else to comfort they at length of the 200 man who have set out from quito only ten return thither and these so weak ragged and disfigured that they could not be recognize orellana go 5 or 600 league down the river pass through various country and nation on both side among whom he affirm that some be amazon -lrb- 94 -rrb- from the mouth of that river orellana go home to spain and excuse himself for have desert pizarro and those who march by land by allege that he have be force down the river by the strength of the current which he be utterly unable to stem by some this river be name after orellana who first navigate its water and other call it the river of the amazon on account of a female suspend from he neck they see neither cross nor image of the virgin nor any indication whatever of the christian religion this country accord to they report be very thinly inhabit more especially in its champaign or level part in which the whole people wander about with they cattle of which they have great abundance live much in the same manner with the arab in barbary remove from place to place accord to the season in search of pasture for they cattle the cattle belong to these indian be almost as large as horse have large horn and bear fleece of wool like sheep on which account the spaniard give they that name they have abundance of another kind of ox or cattle very monstrous in they form have hunch on they back like camel with long beard and long mane like horse the indian live by eat these ox and by drink they blood and clothe themselves in they skin most of they food be raw or at least slightly roasted as they have no pot in which to boil they food they cut they meat with certain knife make of flint they fruit be damsons hazel-nut melon grape pine and mulberry they have dog of such vast strength that one of they will hold a bull be he never so wild when the indian remove from place to place these dog carry they wife child and household stuff on they back and be so strong as to carry fifty pound at once -lrb- 98 -rrb- i omit many other circumstance of this expedition
