portuguese in indium from the departure of de gama in December 1502 to the arrival of alonzo de albuquerque in 1503 _ as soon as the zamorin be assure of the departure of de gama for europe he determine on put he threat in execution against the rajah of cochin for which purpose he gather a army at the village of pananus not far from cochin -lrb- 1 -rrb- this be soon know to the inhabitant of cochin who be exceedingly afraid of the great power of the zamorin and be much dissatisfied with they sovereign for incur the displeasure of that prince out of respect to the christian whom they inveigh against with much bitterness on all occasion and openly insult wherever they be see some that be in high credit with the rajah say openly that as the zamorin be much more powerful than they state we man ought to be deliver up to he as the war be entirely on we account for whom the kingdom ought not to be put in hazard but the rajah much offend at these people declare that he be resolve to defend the portuguese against the zamorin trust that god would favor he in so just a cause yet many of he subject be much inclined to have seize the portuguese belong to the factory but dare not as the rajah give they a place of considerable strength to dwell in and appoint a guard for they security at this time vincente sodre arrive with he squadron in the bay of cochin after have do much damage on the coast of calicut both by land and sea the portuguese head factor send laurenzo moreno to inform sodre of the preparation which be make by the zamorin for the attack of cochin and require he in the name of the king of portugal to land with he man for its defense but sodre answer that he order be to defend the sea and not the land for which reason if the zamorin have prepare to attack cochin by sea he would certainly have defend it but as the war be to be carry on by land he could not interfere and the rajah must defend himself the factor send a second message entreat he in the name of god and on he allegiance to the king of portugal not to abandon the factory in this state of danger as the power of the rajah be inadequate to defend cochin against the zamorin and as the sole object of the war be for the destruction of the factory and the ruin of the portuguese trade it certainly be he duty as captain-general for the king of portugal in these sea both to defend the factory and to give every assistance in he power to the rajah but sodre be immoveable pretend that he have be order to discover the red sea where he expect to make many rich prize and set sail from cochin for cape guardafuus prefer the hope of riches to he duty in defend the factory of cochin the zamorin collect he army as already mention at the village of pananus where besides he own subject and ally several of the principal subject of the rajah of cochin join he standard desert they own sovereign and carry along with they all the power they be able to muster : among these be the caimall or governor of chirapipil and cambalane and of the large island which be opposite to the city of cochin at this place the zamorin make a long speech to he assemble chief in which he endeavor to justify he enmity to the portuguese whom he represent as thief robber and pirate and as have first commence hostility against he without cause he contrast the quiet and friendly conduct of the moor who have trade for 600 year with malabar have never do injury to any in all that time and have greatly enriched the country and have raise he city of calicut to be the greatest emporium in all the indy : whereas the portuguese have take and destroy he ship make he ambassador prisoner insist on have they ship laden before those belong to the moor have take a ship of the moor burnt ten of he ship in he own harbor have destroy he city and force he to escape for safety from he palace take law and vengeance for pretended grievance into they own hand instead of apply regularly to he for redress and since the rajah of cochin be fully inform of all these thing yet persist in favor the portuguese in despite of all remonstrance he have resolve to make war upon he to deprive he of he dominion and to drive these christian intruder out of indium this address give much satisfaction to all the assemble chief and most especially to the lord of repelim who entertain a rooted enmity against the rajah of cochin who have dispossess he of a island call arrnuul the only person who oppose the zamorin on this occasion be nambeadarin -lrb- 2 -rrb- who be brother and next heir to the zamorin he strongly urge the impolicy of drive the christian from malabar to which merchant resort from all place of the world see that the portuguese have make richer present to the zamorin than he have ever receive before and have bring much gold and silver into the country for the purchase of commodity which be not usually do by such as come to make war he represent the attempt of the hostage to escape who have be give for the safety of the portuguese chief and whom the zamorin be please to call ambassador as the first cause of jealousy and distrust yet they be afterwards reconcile and take the large moorish ship at the desire of the zamorin to whom they present the great elephant he say they conduct in trade and otherwise while in calicut be quite satisfactory to all except the moor who be envious against they for interfere in they trade and accuse they falsely of take pepper against the will of the owner which in fact they have do themselves to prevent the christian from load they ship nay that this be so evident that even the zamorin have license the portuguese to take the pepper from the moorish vessel after which the moor have rise against they slaying they man and seize all they goods yet after all these outrage they have give the zamorin a whole day in which to offer reparation and have not seek revenge of they injury treacherously like the moor that he see no cause of go to war against the rajah of cochin for receive the portuguese into he city like any other merchant who might frequent he harbor as have likewise be do by the raja of cananor and koulan who would not have do so if they have be robber and pirate and if the zamorin mean to drive the portuguese from the indy besides make war on cochin it would be necessary for he to do the same against canauor and all the other prince on the coast the zamorin be a good deal stagger by the discourse of nambendarin who have much credit and authority with he insomuch that it be think he would have desist from prosecute the war if it have not be for the moor and the caymal who represent that it would be a great disgrace to he character to recede after the assemblage of so great a army and that it be to be expect the rajah of cochin might now agree from fear to do what the zamorin have desire he the zamorin then desire he sorcerer to point out a fortunate day for march forward with he army which they do accordingly and promise he a assure victory with this assurance on which he place great reliance the zamorin depart from pananus and take possession of repelim which be four league from cochin the rajah of cochin have regular intelligence of all that pass in the camp of the zamorin by means of spy and be in great trouble respect the event not have sufficient force for he defense as many on whom he most rely have go over to the enemy even those who remain serve against they inclination more especially the inhabitant of cochin who abhor we people and say openly that it be proper the rajah should either deliver they up to the zamorin or send they away from cochin to avoid the impending war many of the inhabitant of cochin desert the place for fear of the consequence the member of the portuguese factory be much alarm by all these circumstance and request permission from the rajah to withdraw to cananor where they might remain in safety till the arrival of the next fleet from portugal hope by this mean to remove the cause of war and to satisfy the subject of the rajah trimumpara be displeased at this request as not repose sufficient confidence in he word and declare he would rather forfeit he kingdom and even he life than deliver they up to the zamorin or any other who seek to injure they and that although he might lose cochin in the war there still be place of sufficient strength in which to keep they safe till reinforcement should arrive from portugal that although the zamorin have a great army yet victory do not always follow number as a few valiant man be often victorious over great odds especially have justice on they side he therefore desire the factory to remain and to pray god to give he the victory the portuguese now offer to give he such aid as they small number would allow but he decline allow they to expose themselves to any danger on the present occasion as he credit depend upon the preservation of they life that they might witness for he faithful adherence to the treaty of amity which he have form with they nation upon this he place they under the safeguard of certain naire in whom he have confidence after this the rajah call all he noble into he presence together with the chief naire who be the cause of all the murmur against the portuguese and address the assemblage to the following effect : i be much concern to find that truth and loyalty should be want among man of you quality i do not wonder at the present misconduct of the lower order who be often constrain by they poverty and wretchedness to commit all manner of wickedness but that naire who have always be note for fidelity should desire I to forfeit the promise which i have make to the captain-general in behalf of the portuguese to defend they to the utmost of my power against all violence as my own subject astonish and distress I beyond measure under these assurance of protection which be give with you consent these man be leave in my city and yet because you see the zamorin come against I with more man than i have you would have I to break my promise be i so unjust you of all man ought to abhor I if you dwell with any sovereign on the assurance of he word how would you conceive of he if he be to treat you as you would now have I to act by these christian be it because you be afraid of the great power of the zamorin be assure it be better for we all to die in the discharge of we duty and the preservation of we promise than to live dishonoured to I no evil can be greater than to break my word nor can there be a greater dishonor to yourselve than to be the subject of a false and treacherous king these christian have bring much profit to I and my country and the zamorin might have keep they in he own city if he have permit they factory to settle there in peace be it he intention to drive the christian out of indium and to make war on all who receive they into they dominion he ought to have begin this war with the rajah of cananor : but he cause of war be the envy he have conceive at see I benefit by the trade which he have lose through he own misconduct and because he believe in he pride that i be unable to withstand but i trust in god and the justness of my cause that with you assistance i shall obtain the victory and shall be able to protect the christian and preserve my honor inviolate this speech have great effect upon the assemble naire who be astonish at the constancy and resolution of the rajah they all therefore crave pardon for the fear they have entertain and promise to live and die in he service the rajah immediately call the factor and the rest of the portuguese into he presence to whom he give a account of all that have take place between he and the naire and name before they the prince _ naramuhin _ -lrb- 3 -rrb- he brother and next heir as general of the army which be destine to act against the force of the zamorin command every one to obey he in every respect as if he be himself present naramuhin accordingly march with 5500 naire and entrenched himself at the ford which form the only entry by land into the island of cochin and which be only knee - deep at low water when the zamorin receive notice of the army of cochin have take post at this ford he be somewhat afraid more especially as he know naramuhin be consider to be the bravest and most fortunate warrior in malabar he therefore make a fresh attempt to induce the rajah of cochin to accede to he demand of deliver up the portuguese and they goods otherwise threaten to conquer he dominion and to put all the inhabitant to the sword although the rajah of cochin be quite sensible of the inferiority of he military force and be convince what the zamorin threaten might readily happen he yet determine to remain firm to he engagement and send the follow answer : if you have require with civility what you have proudly command I i should not have esteem you valor lessen by you courtesy : for with man of wisdom and power there be no need for insolent vaunt i have not as yet so sin against god that i should humble myself to vain boasting or think that he should grant you the victory over I and those brave man who fight on my side in spite of all you pride i trust even with the small number i have to defend I in my just quarrel that i shall be enable to overcome you and all my enemy however much you may have practice deceit and injustice it have ever be my rule to avoid shame and dishonor and i will never consent to deliver up the christian or they goods which i have engage to defend the zamorin be much offend by this answer from the rajah of cochin and vow to destroy he whole country in revenge : leave therefore the isle of repelim on the last day of march he enter on the territory of cochin yet refrain from do any injury as he now occupy those part which belong to the chieftain who have join he against they own sovereign on the 2d of march the army of the zamorin make a attempt to force a passage by the ford which be defend by prince naramuhin yet in spite of all he prodigious superiority of number he be force to retire with considerable loss disappoint in this first essay the zamorin encamp close by the ford and send the lord of repelim next day with a still stronger force than have be employ in the first assault to attempt force the passage he even join several armed paraw in this attack but naramuhin make a resolute defense in which he be bravely second by laurenzo moreno and several other portuguese and effectually resist every effort of the zamorin troops who be oblige to retreat with much loss several such assault be make on the ford in all of which the zamorin lose many man and be constantly repulse insomuch that he become fearful of a sinister end to he unjust enterprise and even repent of have begin the war he send however a fresh message to the rajah require he to deliver up the christian as a preliminary of peace but the rajah reply that as he have refuse to do so unjust a action when he have some reason to dread the superior power of the zamorin it be absurd to expect any such thing now when the advantage in the war be evidently of he side he then advise the zamorin to beware of continue the war as he would not now satisfy himself with defense but even hope to give he a signal overthrow and this certainly have be the case if the subject of the rajah have not shamefully desert he in this war and give assistance to the enemy the zamorin almost despaired of success and would have give over the enterprize if he have not be advise by some of he chief to assail several other town belong to the dominion of cochin so as to distract the attention of naramuhin and to weaken he force by oblige he to send detachment for they defense but that brave prince provide against every emergency and make so judicious a disposition of he force that he repulse every effort of the enemy and slew many of they man foiled in every attempt with severe loss by the bravery and excellent disposition of prince naramuhin the zamorin corrupt the paymaster of the troops of cochin who change the usual order of payment which have be daily make in the camp and oblige the soldier to come up to cochin for that purpose naramuhin be oblige to submit to this arrangement by give leave to the naire to go for they wages yet charge they punctually to return to the camp before day but the treacherous paymaster keep they wait till after day-light by which mean the prince be leave with very few troops to defend the ford take advantage of this concerted stratagem the zamorin make a assault upon the ford with he whole force by sea and land and constrain naramuhin to retire with he small band into a grove of palm tree where he be surround by the whole army of calicut yet fight the whole day against such terrible odds with the utmost resolution several time throw he enemy into disorder of whom many be slay but at length overpower by number he and two of he cousin who fight along with he be slay together with most of he faithful follower when this melancholy event be announce to the rajah of cochin he faint from extreme grief and be for some time think to have actually expire at this time the naire be much exasperate against we man to whom they attribute the overthrow and death of prince naramuhin and the desperate situation of they country and seem much inclined to have put the portuguese to death or to have deliver they up to the zamorin on the recovery of the rajah and learn the design of he people against we man he call the portuguese into he presence he give they assurance that even this reverse of he affair should not alter he resolution of protect they both against the zamorin and he own subject he then address he assemble naire urge they not to stain he honor and they own by injure the portuguese whom he and they have swear to protect he exhort they to persevere honourably and bravely in defend they country and preserve they honor inviolate to the christian and comfort they with the assurance that the portuguese fleet would soon arrive with sufficient reinforcement to drive out the zamorin and to restore he to he dominion in the meantime he propose that they should retire with what force remain into the isle of vaipus which be of difficult access and where they could defend themselves till the arrival of the portuguese fleet more especially as the winter be at hand which would stop the progress of the war for some time the naire be astonish at the resolution of they sovereign and promise faithfully to obey he command in all thing the zamorin make a new attempt to shake the resolution of the rajah in he present adversity by offer peace on condition of deliver up the portuguese and they goods which the rajah reject with disdain as he have do all he former overture on this the zamorin give order to destroy the whole country with fire and sword on which intelligence most of the inhabitant of cochin withdraw to other place there be at this time in cochin two milanese lapidary belong to the factory name john marium and pedro antonio who have be bring to india by vasco de gama these man desert to the zamorin to whom they convey intelligence of the consternation which reign among the inhabitant of cochin and of the small number of man that remain with the rajah these man also make offer to the zamorin to make ordnance for he resemble those of the portuguese which they afterwards do as will appear in the sequel of this history and for which service they be highly reward the zamorin now move forwards with he army to take possession of cochin and be resist for some time by the rajah who be himself slightly wound but find it impossible any farther to resist against such prodigious odds he withdraw to the strong island of vaipus carry all we man along with he and every thing belong to we factory the zamorin on take possession of the desert city of cochin order it to be set on fire he then send a part of he army against the isle of vaipus which be valiantly defend by the rajah and he man and in which defense the member of we factory contribute to the best of they ability but the winter come on and bad weather setting in the zamorin be oblige to desist for the present season and withdraw he army to cranganor with a determination to renew the war in the ensue spring leave a strong detachment in the island of cochin which he order to throw up entrenchment for they defense after he shameful desertion of cochin vincente sodre go with he fleet towards the kingdom of cambaya meaning to capture the rich ship of the moor which trade to india from the red sea he there take five ship in which in ready money only be find to the value of 200000 _ perdao _ most of the moor be slay in the battle and the ship burn from cambaya he sail for cape guardafu and as he ship be foul he propose to lay they aground to be careen at the island of _ curia murium _ -lrb- 4 -rrb- sodre arrive there with he squadron on the 20th April 1503 and though these island be well inhabit by moor he resolve to venture on land consider that these islander be by no means warlike and stand in fear of we man the islander accordingly behave in a peaceable manner and sell we people such provision as they have to spare sodre lay one of he caravel aground for repair on which he be inform by the moor that they coast be subject to violent storm in the month of may during which no ship be able to keep the sea but be unavoidably drive on shore and wreck wherefore they advise he strenuously to remove to the other side of the island which would then be a sure defense against the storm after which have blow over he might return to they part of the coast sodre make light of they advice conceive they mean he some harm and tell they that the ship of the moor have only wooden anchor might be easily drive ashore whereas he anchor be of iron and would hold fast pedro raphael hernan rodriguez badarsa and diego perez be convince of the council of the moor be good and therefore quit these island on the last day of April but sodre would not listen to they advice and remain with he brother at curia murium accord to the prediction of the moor a violent storm come on early in may by which the two remain ship be drive from they anchor and dash to piece vincente sodre and he brother with many other lose they life and nothing whatever be save out of these two ship the loss of these two brother be consider as a punishment of providence for basely abandon the rajah of cochin and the factory in they imminent danger those who be save return towards cochin to succor we people and choose pedro de tayde -lrb- 5 -rrb- as they general in they passage from curia murium towards cochin they encounter several severe storm and be often in great danger of perish be unable to reach cochin on account of the wind they be force to take refuge in the island of anchediva a few day after they arrival a ship come there from portugal command by antonio del campo who have leave lisbon alone some time after vasco de gama and have be much delay on he voyage in consequence of the death of he pilot he have encounter severe weather on the coast and be force after much trouble and danger to take refuge in anchediva the unite squadron winter in this island where they suffer severe hardship from scarcity of provision -lrb- 1 -rrb- this army be say to have amount to 50000 man pananus be six league from cochin -- astl i 54 -lrb- 2 -rrb- this person be name naubea daring by astley and be say to have be nephew to the zamorin -- astl i 56 -lrb- 3 -rrb- in astley this prince be call the nephew of the rajah of cochin -- astl i 55 -lrb- 4 -rrb- these be a cluster of island otherwise call chartan and martan on the coast of yeman between the latitudes of 17  and 18  north -- e -lrb- 5 -rrb- of the four officer mention in the text three be enumerate at the commencement of the former voyage of de gama as commander of separate vessel the fourth badarsa be not in that list of captain and may have be appoint captain of vincente sodre flag - ship -- e section vii _ voyage of alonso and francisco de albuquerque to indium in 1503 be the fifth of the portuguese expedition to the east indy _ be the year 1503 suppose that the admiral don vasco de gama have quietly settle factory in cochin and cananor the king of portugal do not consider it necessary to send any great fleet to indium he therefore determine to send only six ship in two separate squadron under separate general alonso de albuquerque who be afterwards governor - general or viceroy of indium command one of these squadron have under he as captain duarte pacheco and hernan martinez mascarenna who be say to have die during the voyage the other squadron likewise of three ship be under the command of francisco de albuquerque cousin to alonso have as captain nichola coello and pedro vas de la vega the former of whom sail under de gama in the first discovery of indium this latter squadron sail from lisbon fifteen day after the other yet arrive first in indium both squadron encounter severe storm during the voyage in which the ship command by de la vega be lose francisco de albuquerque and nichola coello arrive at anchediva in the month of August where they find de tayde and the other captain who have winter there as related in the former section they here receive notice of the war between the zamorin and the rajah of cochin and of the sinister event which have occur at that place for which reason francisco stand over with the whole fleet now consist of six sail to cananor where he expect to receive more exact intelligence of the state of affair in cochin they be here receive with great joy by the portuguese factory and even the rajah of cananor come on board the general ship in person and give he a distinct recital of what have happen at cochin and of the present situation of triumpara alonso de albuquerque lose no time in go to cochin where he arrive on the night of Saturday the 2d of September 1503 immediately on he approach the troops of calicut who guard the entrenchment throw up by the zamorin abandon they post in the island of cochin and flee to cranganor accord to order to that effect from the zamorin who have receive notice of the arrival of we fleet at cananor on Sunday morning francisco come to anchor close to cochin when he be joyfully receive by the inhabitant play on various instrument of music and be soon afterwards visit by the portuguese factor who bring he a message from the rajah on the Monday morning leave he ship in good order francisco take several boat well armed and go to the island of vaipus to visit the rajah order two caravel to follow for security in case of any of the calicut paraw make they appearance the rajah receive we general with infinite satisfaction greet they with the exclamation portugal portugal as soon as we boat be within hail which be answer by we people shout out cochin cochin and down with the zamorin on landing the rajah embrace francisco de albuquerque with tear in he eye say he only desire to live till restore to he dominion that he subject might be satisfy of he just conduct in suffer so much for the service of the king of portugal in the name of that sovereign francisco give hearty thanks to triumpara for he fidelity and promise he ample revenge on he enemy and as he finances be much reduce he make he a present of 10000 crown from the chest belong to the expedition to serve he present necessity until he might be again able to draw the rent of he own dominion this gift be exceedingly acceptable to the rajah whose affair be then at a very low ebb and give much satisfaction to the native who be by it greatly reconcile to the protection which they rajah have give to we man the rajah be immediately bring back in triumph to cochin amid the joyful acclamation of he subject who henceforwards treat we man with esteem and respect the news of the raja return to cochin and of the money which have be give he by we general be speedily communicate to the zamorin who in expectation of the renewal of the war send order to he caymal or governor on the frontier towards cochin to make every preparation for defense on the very day on which the rajah return to cochin francisco de albuquerque resolve to commence hostility by a attack on the island directly over against cochin where he find the inhabitant quite unprepared and off they guard as they have no idea of be so soon attack : in this unprepared state a great number of the calicut troops be slay and several of the town on the island destroy after which the portuguese return to they ship without loss next day francisco make a fresh assault on the same island with six hundred man and be oppose by the caymal or governor for the zamorin with a force of two thousand nayre part of whom be spearman but the greater number arm with bow and arrow and some with sword and target after some resistance but in which none of they be hurt we people make good they landing and gall the indian so sore with they cross-bow that they soon flee the portuguese pursued quite across the island and force they enemy to continue they flight across the water leave many of they man behind both kill and wound have now no enemy to oppose they in the island the portuguese lay it entirely waste and burnt all the town and village it contain adjoining to this island there lay another name _ charanaipin _ -lrb- 1 -rrb- which belong to a caymal who be subject to the rajah of cochin but have revolt to the zamorin at the commencement of the war from some spy employ by the rajah of cochin it be understand that this caymal have a force of three thousand nayre seven hundred of whom be archer and forty be arm with matchlock -lrb- 2 -rrb- besides which all they town be well fortify with trench he have likewise several paraw provide with ordnance with which he be supply by the zamorin and these be station in one of the harbor of the island to defend it against the portuguese notwithstanding all these preparation of which he be well inform francisco albuquerque go against this island the day after he have reduce the former and commence he attack against the harbor in which the paraw be station the enemy be soon drive by we ordnance from they boat yet many of they continue in the water up to they girdle to resist the landing of we troops annoy they as much as possible with stone spear and arrow they be at length drive from the water by we ordnance but rally again on the shore and bravely resist we people in landing for a long time they be at length drive to take shelter in a grove of palm tree in which they defend themselves for a short space and be at the last drive to seek for safety in a disorderly flight in which they be pursue by we man in the pursuit pedro de lare who be constable to francisco de albuquerque be separate from the rest be attack by three nayre all at once one of these let fly a arrow which hit pedro on he breast - plate but without hurt he on which pedro level he piece and shoot he dead the second nayre he likewise slew by another shot the third nayre wound he in the leg with a weapon call a _ gomya _ and then endeavor to run away but pedro kill he with he sword on the enemy be put to flight francisco divide he force into three body two of they portuguese and the third compose of nayre in the service of the rajah of cochin and march all over the island plunder and burn the town and village without resistance while thus employ a considerable number of paraw arrive with reinforcement from calicut from which a powerful body of nayre land in that part of the island where duarte pacheco happen to be post with a very inferior force and have assuredly destroy he and he man but that francisco de albuquerque come very opportunely to he aid find greater resistance than he expect and fear lest the caymal might attack he in the rear while engage in front with the nayre of calicut francisco detach a part of he troops under nichola coello assist by antonio del campo and pedro de tayde to assault the residence of the caymal who be slay bravely fight in its defense at this place one of we man be slay and eighteen wound in the mean time francisco de albuquerque and duarte pacheco defeat the reinforcement from calicut and force they to take refuge on board they paraw leave many of they man slay and wound on the shore after this signal victory by which the greater part of the three thousand nayre belong to the caymal and many of those from calicut be slay francisco de albuquerque confer the honor of knighthood on several of he officer who have signalize themselves on the occasion he then waste the whole island with fire and sword francisco determine in the next place to attack the country of the lord of repelim for which purpose he depart with he troops by water from cochin and reach a town in that territory four league from cochin about eight o'clock next morning near two thousand nayre five hundred of whom be arm with bow and arrow be station on the beach of the isle of repelim to repel this attack but be soon force by we ordnance to retire into a grove of palm on which francisco land with he troops the van be lead by nichola coello the enemy resist for some time under the shelter of the tree and wound some of we people but be at length force to take to flight after lose a good many of they man who be shoot by we cross-bow and _ caliver _ -lrb- 3 -rrb- we troops follow the nayre who take refuge in the town of the island in which much greater slaughter be make of the enemy than in the field as they be crowd together and more expose to we shot on take possession of the town francisco give it up to be plunder by the nayre of cochin who assist he on this expedition that they might not consider the conduct of the portuguese on this occasion proceed from any inclination for plunder the country but from a desire to revenge the injury which have be do to they own rajah on he return from this victory francisco be joyfully receive by the rajah of cochin who desire he to desist from any farther operation against the enemy as he consider himself sufficiently revenge but francisco request he permission to continue the war as he be still unsatisfied till he have take effectual vengeance on the zamorin and account it no trouble to fight in the service of the rajah he seize however the present opportunity of the high favor in which he stand with the rajah to solicit permission for construct a fort at cochin for the protection of the portuguese factory during the absence of the ship this request be immediately comply with the rajah even offer to be at the sole charge and francisco lose no time in proceed to construct the intended fort as there be neither stone lime nor sand to be procure it be necessary to build the castle of timber which the rajah order to be immediately provide for the purpose and bring to the spot appoint which be close to the river side as best adapt for resist the assault of the calicut fleet in any future attempt against cochin the rajah send likewise a great number of he subject to carry on the work say that we people have already have enough to do in the operation of the war : but francisco command we people to work in construct the fortification the foundation of which be lay on the 26th September 1503 the inhabitant of cochin be astonish at the diligence with which we people labor at this work say there be no such man in the world as they be equally good at all thing on the 30th September four day after the commencement of the fort alonso de albuquerque arrive with he ship at cochin have be delay on he voyage by severe storm and contrary wind yet bring all he man with he in excellent health francisco be much pleased at he arrival and a portion of the fort be allot to those newly arrive it be soon finish though build of timber this castle be as strong and handsome as if it have be construct of stone and lime it be of a square form each face be eighteen yard with bulwark or bastion at each corner mount with ordnance the wall be make of two row of palm tree and other strong timber firmly set in the ground and bind together with iron hoop and large nail the space between the two row of timber be ram full of earth and sand and the whole surround by a ditch always full of water -lrb- 4 -rrb- the day after this fort be finish which be name manuel in honor of the king of portugal the captain - general with all he people make a solemn procession in which the vicar of the fort bear the crucifix under a canopy carry by the captain of the fleet precede by trumpet and other instrument of music the fort be solemnly bless and consecrate by the celebration of mass after which friar gaston preach a sermon in which he exhort he hearer to be thankful to god who have permit the inhabitant of the small western kingdom of portugal to construct a fortress in this distant region among so many enemy of the catholic faith he express a hope that this might be the forerunner of many other establishment of a similar nature to the advancement of the true religion among the heathen and the glory of portugal he likewise desire he hearer to keep always in mind the high obligation they owe to the rajah for the good service he have render to the king of portugal on this occasion a faithful report be carry to the rajah of this part of the discourse who be much gratified and give thanks for the same to the two general after complete the fort the portuguese renew the war and make a attack on two town belong to the lord of repelim on the coast about five league from cochin have learn from spy that they be but slightly garrison on this expedition the general take a body of seven hundred man and depart from cochin about two hour before day they arrive at they destination about nine o'clock next morning these town have a population of six thousand people besides child and be only defend by three hundred nayre all bowman alonso de albuquerque with part of the force land at the nearest town and francisco with the remainder of the force at the other which be only about a cannon-shot distant from the former in the first town the enemy be completely surprised and run away and the place be set on fire without resistance on see the people run away we man pursue and slew many of the fugitive and when wearied of the pursuit they plunder and destroy the country in the mean time the alarm be spread over the neighborhood and about 6000 nayre assemble who make a attack upon we man as they be embark so that they be in great danger : in particular duarte pacheco not be able to find he boat in the place where he have leave it be closely pursued and though he and he company defend themselves valiantly and kill many of the enemy eight of he man be wound with arrow so superior be the number of the enemy on this occasion that pacheco and he man have assuredly be all slay if the rest of the troops have not again land to he rescue on which the enemy lose heart and run away leave the field of battle strew over with they slay after the defeat of the nayre we man set fire to fifteen paraw which be draw up on the beach and carry away seven which be afloat the lord of repelim be much grieve at the destruction of he town and be afraid of we people make a attack on another about a league farther up the river he send a strong detachment of he nayre for its security the general however resolve to follow up they victory and to do all the evil in they power to the territory of this lord for this purpose after allow they man some time for rest they depart about midnight while it be still so dark that they could not see each other in the boat expect to come upon they enemy by surprise by dawn of next morning the boat in which alonso de albuquerque and he party be embark get considerably a-head of the rest and arrive at the town which it be intend to attack a good while before day weary of wait for the rest he land he man and give order to set the town on fire at first they be successful in this rash enterprise as the ordinary inhabitant be a cowardly unarmed people but the garrison of above two thousand nayre have assemble on the alarm attack alonso and he man with great fury and force they to retreat to they boat after kill one man and wound several other of the party which only consist originally of forty man alonso and he soldier would not have be able to make good they retreat if the sailor who remain in charge of the boat have not fire off a falcon -lrb- 5 -rrb- or small piece of ordnance on which the nayre give over the pursuit by this time day break and francisco de albuquerque approach with the rest of the boat and see the perilous situation of alonso he command the ordnance in the boat to be play off against the enemy on which they flee from the shore at this time pacheco who be somewhat astern of the rest observe a great number of armed nayre march along a narrow passage to reinforce the other at the town and bring he boat so near the pass that he completely stopt they passage that way the whole of we man be now land and soon constrain the enemy to take flight with considerable loss after which they set the town on fire but do not think it prudent to pursue the runaway as they be not acquaint with the country after this exploit duarte pacheco and pedro de tayde go with they division to destroy another town at some distance in they way towards which they fight and defeat eighteen paraw belong to the zamorin and then set the town on fire from thence they stand over to the island of _ cambalan _ the caymal of which be a enemy of the cochin rajah where they destroy a large town from that place pacheco go with five armed paraw of cochin to burn another town where he meet with considerable resistance and slew a great number of the enemy seven of he own people be wound after set the town on fire he retire towards cochin and be force to fight with thirteen armed paraw of calicut which he defeat with the assistance of pedro de tayde and antonio del campo who fortunately join he in this emergency on they defeat the calient paraw retire into a creek where one of they run aground and be take by pacheco but we man be worn out with hard rowing be unable to pursue the rest and return to cochin on receive a account of these transaction the rajah be much satisfied with the revenge which have be take of he enemy and request of we general to discontinue the war to which however they be by no means incline on account of the war no pepper be bring from the country to sell at the factory in cochin neither dare the merchant to go out in search of that commodity insomuch that the factory have only be able to procure 300 _ bahar _ -lrb- 6 -rrb- and the factor request the general to go in quest of some which be to be procure at a place about nine league from cochin for this purpose the two general and all they captain set out from cochin under night that they intention might not be discover by the enemy on the way pacheco destroy a whole island in which he fight against six thousand of the enemy with he own company only and the two general put thirty-four paraw to flight after this pacheco and del campo destroy a town on the continent where they defeat two thousand nayre many of whom be slay without any loss on they side after this the general send on the _ tony _ -lrb- 7 -rrb- for the pepper which carry such merchandize as be mean to be give in exchange and for its protection pacheco and three other captain accompany it with two hundred man and five hundred cochin paraw -lrb- 8 -rrb- in pass a narrow strait or river we people be assail from the bank by a vast number of the native arm with bow and arrow but be defend by they target which be fix on the gunwale of they boat leave one of he captain with fifty portuguese t protect the tony pacheco with the other two captain and the troops belong to the rajah make towards the shore firing off he falcon against the enemy whom he force to quit the shore with much loss after which he land with he troops most of whom be arm with hand-gun the enemy who be full two thousand strong resist for a quarter of a hour but at length take to flight after have many slay pacheco pursue they to a village where the fugitive rally and be join by many nayre insomuch that they now amount to six thousand man and we people be in great jeopardy as the enemy endeavor to surround they and to intercept they return to the boat but we man defend themselves manfully and fight they way back to the shore where the native divide on each hand be afraid of the shot of the falcon which slew great number of they and we man re-embark without have a single man kill or wound the zamorin be much displeased at the success of we people against he confederate and by the loss of many of he paraw in these several action and be even afraid lest the portuguese might eventually dispossess he of he dominion he use every exertion therefore to prevent we from procure pepper be in hope if we ship be constrain to return to portugal without load that they would come no more back to indium he use he influence therefore even with the merchant of cochin to refuse supply pepper to we ship which they do so effectually under pretence of the war that in spite of the influence of the rajah and notwithstanding high offer of reward from francisco de albuquerque the factory have only be able to procure 1200 quintal or 4000 bahar -lrb- 9 -rrb- of pepper and even that be get with hard fight some hurt to we own man and infinite loss of life to the enemy unable to procure any more pepper in cochin alonso de albuquerque go to coulan in search of that commodity accompany by pedro de tayde and antonio del campo know that the government of that state be desirous of have one of we factory establish in they city and have solicit both pedro alvare cabral and the lord admiral de gama to that effect and alonso be determine to go to war with the people of coulan unless they give he load for he ship coulan be twelve league from cochin and twenty-four from cape comorin before the building of calicut coulan be the principal city of malabar and the port of greatest trade on that coast its building more especially the temple and shrine of they idol be larger and more splendid than those of cochin the haven be excellent the country be well store with provision and the condition of the people resemble in all thing what have be formerly say of the inhabitant of calicut the inhabitant be idolatrous malabar have among they many rich moorish merchant more especially since the war break out between we and the zamorin as many of these merchant have leave calicut to reside at coulan they trade with coromandel ceylon the maldive island bengal pegu camatium and malava the rajah or king of this state rule over a extensive kingdom in which there be many rich city and several good harbor by which mean he have a large revenue and be able to maintain a great military force but the man be mostly of a low stature : he entertain in he palace a guard of three hundred woman arm with bow and arrow who be very expert archer and they bind up they breast very tight with bandage of silk and linen that they may not stand in the way of use they bow this rajah usually reside in a city name calle and be generally at war with the king of narsinga -lrb- 10 -rrb- in the city of coulan which be govern by certain officer or alderman there be a church which be build by the apostle st thoma who come here to preach the catholic faith and make many convert both among the idolater and other who have hand down the christian belief from generation to generation so that there be at least twelve thousand family of christian scatter abroad in the country in which they have church in many place the king who then rule in coulan be much displeased at the number of he subject who be convert to christianity banish st thoma from he dominion who then go to a city call malapur or meliapor on the coast of the dominion of narsinga and be follow by the christian of coulan and even by many of the idolater he be say to have retire into a solitude in the mountain where he die and whence he body be remove for interment in a vault of the church he have build at coulan this church be now desert and entirely overgrow with tree and bush and be keep by a poor moorish zealot who subsist on alms which he receive from christian pilgrim and even some of the idolater give alms at this tomb on the arrival of alonso de albuquerque at the harbor of coulan the governor of the city come on board to visit he and settle a treaty with he in which it be stipulate that we be to have a factory in the city and that they should provide a load with all possible dispatch for the three ship he have along with he while one of he ship be take in a lading in the harbor the other two always keep out at sea watch all ship that pass and oblige every one they could descry to come and give a account of themselves to albuquerque as captain - general under the king of portugal he offer no injury to any of these unless to such as belong to the moor of the red sea all of which that fall in he way be first plunder and then burnt in revenge for the injury they have do to the portuguese when the house for the factory be finish and the ship laden alonso leave there antonio de sola as factor with two clerk rodrigo aranso and lopo rabelo a interpreter name medera and two friar to serve as chaplain together with other assistant be twenty in all after which he return to cochin about this time francisco de albuquerque receive a message from _ cosebequin _ a friendly moor of calicut who have be formerly mention give he notice that the zamorin be determine to make another attack on cochin so soon as the portuguese fleet have depart for europe and to fortify it in such a manner as should prevent they from have any farther intercourse with that country with this view the zamorin have enter into treaty with all the raja and lead nayre or noble of malabar and it be even rumor that those of cananor and coulan have secretly enter into term with he against the portuguese and the rajah of cochin -lrb- 11 -rrb- he say farther that the moorish merchant have promise large assistance for carry on the war as they be exceedingly desirous to exclude the christian from trade to india about the same time a letter come from rodrigo reynel to the same effect say that the zamorin be levying troops and have cause a great number of cannon to be prepare for the war : reynel likewise say that the moor of cochin be decidedly in the interest of the zamorin and be therefore to be look to with much jealousy the rajah likewise inform albuquerque that from certain bramin who have come from calicut he be inform of the intention and preparation of the zamorin for reduce cochin and as he have little reliance on he own subject he request some portuguese troops might be leave for he defense francisco give the rajah assurance of protection and even that the portuguese would add to he dominion at a future period in reward for he fidelity and friendship to they nation and as a compensation for the injury he have suffer in they cause the rajah be much pleased with this assurance and as francisco find he could have no more pepper at cochin he determine upon return to portugal when he have appoint a fit person to remain as captain-general in indium he find this matter difficult as none of he captain be willing to remain with the small force which he be able to leave behind at length duarte pacheco willingly accept the charge and the rajah be much pleased with he appointment have already sufficient proof of he valor pacheco be accordingly leave at cochin with he own ship and two caravel command by pedro raphael and diego perez and a pinnace with ninety man in health besides other who be sick -lrb- 12 -rrb- as much ordnance and ammunition be likewise give he as could possibly be spare from the homeward bind ship all these thing be settle francisco de albuquerque sail for cananor where he propose to endeavor to procure the liberty of rodrigo reynel and the other who be at calicut but the zamorin send he word that there be no necessity to take this person away who be desirous of remain in indium and if the captain-general would remain he should have the pepper which be promise -lrb- 13 -rrb- at this time alonso de albuquerque return from coulan and join francisco at cananor and a letter be bring from rodrigo reynel give information that the zamorin be certainly resolve to attempt the conquest of cochin as soon as the portuguese ship should leave the coast and that he only intention in make a offer of pepper be with a view to prevent they from burn the ship which be then in the harbor of calicut all matter be arrange the portuguese fleet sail from cananor on the 31st of January 1504 alonso de albuquerque and antonio del campo come to lisbon on the 23d of August and present to the king 400 weight of seed pearl which be call _ alhofer or ragge _ 144 pound weight of great pearl and eight of the oyster from which the pearl be procure -lrb- 14 -rrb- he give likewise to the king a diamond as big as a large bean and many other jewel and two persian horse of wonderful swiftness francisco de albuquerque and nichola coello who leave cananor some time after alonso be cast away on the voyage and never more hear of pedro de tayde be drive to quiloa where he ship be lose on the bar and most of he man drown from quiloa he go to mozambique in a _ zambucco _ where he afterwards die but leave a letter in which he give a particular account of the state of affair in indium which he order to be deliver to the first captain who might put in there from portugal -lrb- 15 -rrb- \* \* \* \* \* antonio de saldanna the last of the three commander who be send to cruise in the north of the red sea have lose diego fernandez peteira come to anchor at a place call st thoma on the east side of the cape of good hope which be make famous by the name of _ aquada del saldanna _ or saldanna watering-place on account of he have lose several of he man there in endeavor to land at this time ruy lorenzo be part from he in a storm which drive he to mozambique whence he hold on he course for quiloa where he take some small prize be ambitious to distinguish himself he go to the island of zanzibar twenty league short of mombasa where he take twenty small vessel after this he appear before the town of mombasa the king of which place send out a number of armed almadia or paraw to take he ship : but lorenzo arm he long boat with a crew of thirty man which take four of the almadia and kill a great many of the moor the king send a army of 4000 man to the shore under the command of he son who be kill with some other at the first volley on which one of the moor run out from the rank with a flag of the portuguese arm craving a parley peace be soon conclude by which the king agree to pay 100 _ metical _ of gold yearly as a tribute to the king of portugal -lrb- 16 -rrb- from mombasa lorenzo sail for melinda the king of which place be much oppress by he of mombasa on account of he connection with the portuguese on he way he take two ship and three small vessel call _ zambucco _ in which be twelve magistrate of brava who submit they city to the king of portugal and engage to give 500 metical of yearly tribute on he arrival at melinda he find that a battle have be fight between the king of melinda and mombasa in which neither could claim the victory antonio de saldanna likewise arrive at melinda about this time and by he mediation peace be restore between these prince saldanna and lorenzo go thence to the mouth of the red sea where they defeat some moor at the island of _ kanakanus _ -lrb- 17 -rrb- beyond cape guardafu on the upper coast of arabium they burn one ship belong to the moor which be laden with frankincense and they drive another on shore which carry a number of pilgrim for mecca -lrb- 1 -rrb- this seem to be
