from by way of sofalum -- e -lrb- 8 -rrb- this allude to the maldive and lakedive -- e section iii _ letter from peter pasqualus orator of the venetian republic at the court of the king of portugal to he brother dwelling in lisbon _ -lrb- 1 -rrb- beloved brother i formerly write you by peter verzo the carrier inform you of all the news of this place and now write again by bartholomew marquesus the uncle of dominic benedicto of florence that you may be inform of we affair and may be assure of we desire to write whenever a opportunity offer know therefore that the vessel which be send out last year towards the north by the king of portugal under the command of caspar corterato have now return he report have discover a continent about 2000 mile from hence in a direction between the north-west and the west hitherto utterly unknown he be likewise say to have sail almost 800 mile along its coast without find any end on which account it be consider to be a continent and not a island : and its coast appear to join with another land formerly discover almost under the very north -lrb- 2 -rrb- but the vessel be unable to proceed so far on account of the sea be freeze and from excessive fall of snow it be conclude from the number of river which descend from the snowy mountain that this land must be a continent as no island could possibly supply so many river the land be say to be well cultivate the house of the inhabitant be construct of wood cover with hide or the skin of fish the vessel now arrive have bring over seven of the native of both sex and the other ship which be hourly expect be say to have fifty in stature color appearance and dress these people be very like the _ cinganus _ they be clothe in the skin of fish and otter and other hairy skin like those of wolf wear the fur side inwards in winter as we do and outwards in summer but these be not fashion or sew together be use in they natural form these be principally worn on they arm and shoulder and they loin be gird with many cord make of sinew they appear a savage people yet not impudent and be well make in all they limb they face be puncture with many mark like the indian have six or eight punctured line more or less accord to they fancy in which they seem to take great delight they have a language which be not understand by any one although interpreter of almost every tongue have be try they country be destitute of iron yet they have sword edge with sharp stone and they arrow be point by the same means and be sharper even than ours we people bring from thence part of a broken sword with gilded ornament which seem of italian manufacture a certain boy be say to have be see in that country have two silver ball bang from he ear which certainly appear to be engrave after we manner on the whole it may be conclude that this country be a continent not a island and that be a new discovery for if any ship have ever be here before we should assuredly have hear something respect it the coast abound in fish particularly salmon herring and many other of that kind there be forest which abound in all kind of tree so that _ they build _ -lrb- 3 -rrb- ship with mast yard bench and all thing conformable on this account the king of portugal have resolve to convert this discovery to profit both on account of the abundance of wood which be fit for many purpose and because the native be accustom to labor may become very useful and indeed i have never see better slave i have deem it consistent with we friendship to acquaint you with these thing and when the other vessel arrive which be daily expect i shall communicate other particulars the fleet have sail for calicut and the king have order that it shall seize the fleet of mecca that the soldan of syrium may neither have access there in future nor may export any more spice the king of portugal be satisfy that every thing shall go accord to he wish in this respect and the court and all the nation be of the same opinion should this purpose succeed it be incredible how abundant this kingdom must soon become in all kind of riches and merchandize and from hence the ship of venice in particular will have to bring they accustomed article of trade to we truly who formerly sustain this branch of commerce entirely by we own resource this decree will be injurious unless he shew we favor -lrb- 1 -rrb- this letter be date 9th October 1501 it be probable that pasqualus would hardly write this _ from _ the court of portugal to he brother in _ lisbon _ it be more likely that they reside in venice -- e -lrb- 2 -rrb- the discovery here refer to seem to have be the coast of labradore and the other country under the north may possibly be greenland this voyage be probably in quest of a north-west passage to indium -- e -lrb- 3 -rrb- in this passage we surely ought to read _ ship may be build _ -- e section iv _ letter from franci sagitta of cremona from lisbon direct to the venetian orator peter pasqualus reside at the court of castile _ -lrb- 1 -rrb- most excellent orator in two former letter i have promise to omit no opportunity of inform you excellency what kind of merchandize might be bring in four vessel which be expect daily from indium they be now arrive and i shall truly state all the merchandize which they have bring which be as follow : one thousand quintal of pepper 450 quintal of cinnamon about fifty quintal of ginger fifty quintal of lac : and as much cotton as may be buy for 400 ducat the reason assign for have bring so small a quantity of spice be that they agree among themselves after sail from hence that two of the ship should steer for the gold mine and the other two for calicut on this account each take only such goods as it be think would be value in the port to which they be bind but when these ship come to calicut they be not allow to trade and be oblige to go to other place on go to cananore they there learn what have be do by peter aliari the factor at cochin for the king the king or rajah of cananore receive we people honourably and offer to supply we commander gratuitously with all kind of spice but thank he gratefully for this kindness he decline the offer say that he must go in the first place to the king factor at cochin and would then return and accept he spice on credit set out therefore for cochin he transact business with the royal agent peter aliari but as the ship do not bring money for they purchase and as the goods they bring be in small request and they could not therefore succeed in make purchase the commander resolve to return to cananore where the rajah have express so much good will for the portuguese and where he barter he merchandize for spice at a good profit he here leave three person with the ship factor and a clerk because the rajah have advance money on credit for the spice that they might not appear to have cheat the rajah yet after all the ship have to come away only half loaded because they have not take out money for they purchase and they goods be in no request the conclusion from this be evident that the indian have no demand for we goods and that money alone be especially desire by they and of which they be in great need it have be report since that these king of the indy give as much merchandize to we admiral without price as would load four ship out of fear of the christian especially the king of calicut who have be tell by he soothsayer to beware of the ensue year as the star threaten he with a great slaughter of he man by the christian and that he kingdom even would be desert owe to dread of that people we have this intelligence from three man who escape from the battle at _ araschorea _ with the barbarian the same thing be report by a native of bergamo who have dwell twenty-five year at calicut which be likewise confirm by a native of valentium who have sojourn there six year in the meantime the king of calicut fit out a large fleet to attack we ship at cananore but they immediately seek for safety by set sail on this account the king of portugal have order eight or ten ship of burthen to be fit out by next January of which seven be already build two ship have be send out this summer one of which be of 700 ton burthen and the other of 500 there be a third in the port of lisbon of 450 ton two other at madeira one of 350 and the other of 230 ton another be fitting out at setubal carry above 160 ton besides these six a caravel be to be add which lately come from the island of chio all of which be entirely at the royal charge and two be to be fit out by the king for certain merchant one of 450 ton and the other of 350 it be agree between these merchant and the king that the king shall be at the sole expence of the voyage and payment of the sailor as in he service that the merchant shall carry out as much money as may suffice for all they purchase and on the return of the ship half of the goods shall belong to the king and the merchant shall be at liberty to sell the other half for they own behoof it appear evident to we that this mode of conduct business will be greatly more to the benefit of the merchant than go entirely at they own risk as have be do hitherto so that the king will probably find abundance of people willing to trade to india on these condition we have accordingly a share in these two ship but of the event god alone can judge -lrb- 1 -rrb- this letter be date 16th September 1502 and by it p pascqualus appear to have go from portugal into spain : -- e section v _ of the weight and money of calicut and of the place whence they procure they spice _ -lrb- 1 -rrb- have already treat concern the article of commerce of all kind in the indy it be proper to give some account of the price and weight of these in the city of calicut a _ bahar _ of nutmeg be sell for 450 _ favus _ a bahar consist of four quintal of 100 pound each and twenty _ favi _ be equal to a ducat a bahar of cinnamon cost 390 favus a _ faraculum _ or the twentieth part of a bahar of dry ginger be six favus a faraculum of candied ginger be twenty-eight favus a bahar of tamarind thirty favus a bahar of the best pepper 400 favus a bahar of _ zerombecus _ forty favus a bahar of myrabolan 560 favus a bahar of zedoary thirty favus a bahar of red sander eighty favus a bahar of lac 260 favus a bahar of _ sanasius _ 160 a bahar of mastic 430 favus a _ faraculum _ of camphor 160 a bahar of pepper 360 a faraculum of frankincense five favus a faraculum of benzoin six favus a faraculum of aloe wood 400 favus a faraculum of cassium eleven favi a faraculum of rhubarb 400 favus a bahar of clove 600 fevus a faraculum of opium 400 favus a bahar of white sander 700 favus a mitrical of ambergris or six ounce and a quarter a bahar contain twenty faracula a faraculum fourteen aratolla and a third as twenty-three venetian aratolla be equal to twenty-two portuguese pound a golden ducat be equal to twenty favus as to those thing which be carry from europe for sale at calicut a faraculum of brass sell for forty-five favus a faraculum of white coral for 1000 a faraculum of silver for twenty favus a faraculum of spurious coral for 300 a faraculum of alum twenty a almenum of saffron sell for eighty favus : the almenum exceed the portuguese pound two aratolla and a half and be therefore equal to about three venetian pound it appear proper to mention the region from whence the various spice be bring to calicut pepper be bring from a certain tower near the coast about fifty league beyond calicut cinnamon come from a country call _ zolon _ ceylon 260 league beyond calicut and from no other place clove come from the district of _ meluza _ which be twelve portuguese league from calicut and be in the country of cananore nutmeg and mastic come from _ meluza _ which be 740 league from calicut -lrb- 2 -rrb- castor which be musk come from a certain region call pegu 500 league from calicut fine pearl come from the coast of _ armuzus _ -lrb- 3 -rrb- 700 league from calicut spikenard and myrabolan from the province of _ columbaium _ -lrb- 4 -rrb- 600 league from calicut cassium _ in twig _ -lrb- 5 -rrb- be procure in the territory of calicut frankincense be bring from _ saboea _ -lrb- 6 -rrb- 800 league distant aloes-wood rhubarb camphor and calinga be send from the country of chiva -lrb- 7 -rrb- 4000 league from calicut myrrh from the province of _ fastica _ -lrb- 8 -rrb- 700 league distant calicut produce _ zeromba _ -lrb- 9 -rrb- and cananore send cardamom be only twelve league distant long pepper be find in _ same _ -lrb- 10 -rrb- benzoin from _ zan _ 700 mile from calicut zedoary be produce in the territory of calicut lac come from the city of _ samoterra -lrb- 11 -rrb- 500 league distant brasil wood from the region of _ tannazar _ 500 league opium from the coast of _ adde _ 700 league -lrb- 1 -rrb- this section be take from the _ novus orbus _ of grynaeus p 63 in which it form part of the navigation from
